description:
Came for brunch Saturday at 11 and got a table outside right away. I brought my big dog and he was comfortable and welcome!! They had multiple ciders to choose from and the bartender was really friendly. Unfortunately they were out of the roast beef so I went with the pulled pork and it was just okay. 

Me and the big guy will be back for more cider and sunshine soon!
author: Siobhain G.

description:
An OK-place for a catch-up drink with friends and a light lunch, but it really is mediocre for what it is. 

I agree with Christine K. that they're really nice to their regulars, but it's often at the expense of new customers. My friend and I stood at the front waiting to order for about five minutes before they turned away and asked us what we wanted. Even then, it took a while for them to get their point of sale system working properly and swipe my credit card.

There's some really cool dishes on the menu, including the trademark pork belly donuts. I accepted my fate of a sugar overload and got a plate of those plus a blackberry cider, which was quite refreshing on a sunny day. It was freakishly sunny when we dined there -- large groups were hogging the umbrellas and we had to squeeze past several parties to even find a seat at the end of the picnic table. We were so far in the back that our server almost didn't see us when she brought out our chicken and waffle and donuts.

The food is classic rich brunch fare, albeit done in smaller, manageable portions. Pork belly donuts are delicious, like tempura batter filled with tender, fatty meat. When paired with their light maple syrup, it makes for a filling meal. My friend really enjoyed his fried chicken and waffle, even though it was much smaller than he thought it'd be. Dishes were generally affordable -- about $16 for the donuts and drink.

We enjoyed our brews -- they have a giant drink menu and there's something for everyone, even those who prefer non-alcoholic beverages. There's also a bunch of board games you can borrow, which makes it an appealing place to sit and eat for a while. My problem is that there's so many people who spend too long there -- we had trouble finding a seat because other parties were hanging out with their empty mimosa pitchers, and the staff knew them all so they were allowed to stay for ages after they'd finished. I, on the other hand, left with no regrets and no intentions to come back.
author: Gwen W.

description:
Drinks and food are alright (nothing special but not bad for the prices). Service is somewhere between weird and shitty. They're nice to their friends/regulars but a bit too dismissive of everyone else, even when it's not crowded. It's like they pick out who they're gonna shit on when they walk through the door. 

Would maybe come back for the convenience (location, they take credit card for $10+, plus smoking is okay in the back patio) but definitely don't expect polite service. Generous tipping doesn't help either.
author: Christine K.

description:
Came here for their drinks!  I can't comment much on their divey bar food, but I'm sure it's great for the vibe it portrays and exudes! 

Hipster Biergarten outdoors and cinema screen outside playing of some sort on the neighbor's wall! 

Let's grab drinks, gather and chill!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
Warning: These bottomless mimosas will f you up. And at only $14. 

The Sycamore is only a short walk from the 16th street BART station, so have no fear, you will have time to sober afterward. I highly recommend taking public transportation for this reason. 

I also ordered a salmon benedict which I consumed before the inebriation. So with accurate memory, I can say that it actually tasted a bit sour. I heard sometimes poached eggs are put in a vinegar for a short time? Not sure what for, but I could certainly taste it. And I wouldn't say I liked it...but I also wouldn't say I didn't....

When you walk in, it doesn't look like much. There's actually a lot of limited seating indoors - but remember, the party is in the back! Ample outdoor seating, picnic style.
author: Melanie B.

description:
Walked up to the Sycamore with two coworkers I was traveling with on a chilly spring night and were enticed by the warm cozy atmosphere to come in and grab a drink!

I went with the Crispin blackberry cider, and it was delicious.

We were all a bit hungry, so we ordered sliders with fries, and Mac n cheese bites.

The sliders were delicious and gone in moments!  And the Mac n cheese bites were super hearty and fresh.  I loved the mixture of spices within it, better than just plain Mac n cheese.
author: Alexis D.

description:
I'll admit when I saw the neighborhood and the restaurant I was nervous. Don't be! Go with it and you will be pleased. The service is phenomenal. My bottomless mimosa glass never reached the bottom. The vibe here reminds me of my former hometown of Austin. Eccentric with board games and employees that make their own rules. The music was r and b and hip hop, anything you wanna groove to while day drinking. The space is small but there is a patio. 

I ordered the chicken and waffles. The waffle was filled with prosciutto. The batter was seasoned sweetly with nutmeg and cinnamon. Imagine smoky, salty and sweet all at once. You also get two fried chicken strips. They were really good too, flavorful batter and great crunch. There are also strawberries to give you a healthy feel lol well for a few bites. The makers mark syrup is amazing too! Bourbon syrup is what I need in my life every day.

I was pleasantly surprised and I'm happy I didn't let my boujee attitude sway me away from this awesome place
author: Alexis M.

description:
As amazing as the reviews state....

I wanted to try a funky place in the Mission with bottomless mimosas, and damn me to hell, this was it. 

My mimosa barely ever had a bottom, my Benedict was intensely flavorful, and if you do not order the pork belly donuts then you should live the rest of your life in shame.

I feel like this place embodies the spirit and soul of San Francisco's Mission District. Get some extra culture by browsing the street art in the alleys nearby :).
author: Jenna M.

description: Great ambiance, friendly service and cool crowd. One of my favorite hangouts in the Mission!
author: Ariana S.

description:
The Sycamore is fun. It's a different take on bottomless brunch. I'm used to it being a little boujee, but the Sycamore is super casual (and super affordable).

Our glasses were frequently refilled, and the staff was fun and friendly. The ambiance was divey and welcoming. Great music. 80s hits. Whenever a new song came on, you'd go, "Aw, I love this song!"

I liked not having to spend $50 on brunch. Bottomless mimosas were $12 with $10 minimum of food. We got the mix 'n match sliders: two breakfast chicken sliders, a lamb burger, and the ground beef. The chicken slider was super decadent. I loved the biscuit it was on, and I could have eaten one just on its own. It was good, but I liked the ground beef better. That aioli was yummy. It packed a lot of flavor into that tiny burger. My date preferred his lamb burger to the chicken.

Fries were yummy. Cheap(ish) meal was filling. I'd go back again.
author: Kelsey S.

description:
The Sycamore is a dive bar that also serves a wide variety of food items. I came in for lunch on a Saturday since I was in the Mission District, and it was fairly busy but not packed at that time. I tried:

-Pork Belly "Donuts" w/Maple Syrup & Makers Mark Glaze (3/$7.75, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=9rt6k4XYCUzbbH7GRBv-nw&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg): Interesting concept, but the pork belly pieces had way too much fat (even for me, and I love pork belly fat). I was also expecting the pieces to be crunchy and the donuts more solid/cake like. However, the donuts were more on the doughy side. I wouldn't get this again.
-Sycamore's Famous Roast Beef ($9.25, https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=lk7pLO8TUivp7SMyiZ98Xw&userid=76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg): We got the sandwich with mayo and sauce, and they definitely put a lot of both on. The sauce was like a tangy BBQ sauce, and I'm not sure how well both went with the sandwich. The bread was also too soft to support all the beef and sauce, and got soggy really quickly- skip!

Service was ok- not great but fairly attentive. Overall, the food wasn't very good, but I would return here for drinks. The drink prices seem very reasonable, and they have a large variety and quantity of beers on draft. Parking in this area can be really tough on weekend nights, but there were some spots on the street available during the day.
author: Amy D.

description:
Really appreciate server going the extra mile in service and constantly keeping drinks replenished.
It's great. Go here.
author: Gold L.

description: Pork belly donuts are to die for. That's it.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Lines are too long with not enough room to sit. Food was decent, bloody Mary's tastes like plain tomato juice, & the bartenders have mediocre personalities. 
If you want "okay enough to eat" food drinks and service... you've found your new spot.
author: Bailey G.

description:
2 stars for the wonderful bartender and the good beer. 

However, the food & service is awful. My friends order came out, I spoke up and said it was for him (he was mid convo) and the server slammed the order down on the table and said to him "fucking speak up when its your order." I responded to him within ten seconds of his arrival, the fact he felt comfortable speaking to us this way because my friend didn't answer and I did was weird and unnecessary. I ordered chicken tenders, they arrived completely BURNT, obviously they tasted charred and super dry, I'm no chef but your frying oil is too hot if you can't manage decent chicken! Suffice to say I'll never eat here again, there's really a difference between the expected dive bar employee attitude and just being a total miserable person inept of basic human interaction, he was the latter.
author: Meesha R.

description: My friends and I stopped by this place for a bite to eat and to kill time before watching some football games. Not being from the west coast/San Fran trying to find parking is a nightmare and the area looked sketchy, but that was expected. We all took over the patio which was a great space to hang. I was a little skeptical on ordering food because I thought I'd just be terrible bar food, but i was proven wrong. They had a veggie burger on the menu to my surprise and it was awesome! Has some good sauce on it too. One of the better ones I've had. The burgers don't come with sides so you'd have to order them separate, but prices for beer and the burger were reasonable. This is a great local spot and if I lived in the area I'd definitely come back.
author: Brina M.

description:
I stopped in for a quick lunch after a meeting. The Sycamore is a solid place to sit back, relax, enjoy a cold beer and good bite. They have daily specials so be sure to check the daily schedule for food/beer options. 

For lunch I ordered three sliders and a beer. 
BLT Slider: bacon, butter lettuce, tomato, and herb aioli ($3.95).
Fried Chicken: fried breast, pickled red onion, slaw, and garlic aioli ($3.95)
Beef Slider: ground beef, caramelized onion, blue cheese, and garlic aioli ($3.95)
Add fries for $1.75. The Fries were cooked well done (excellent) and topped with salt and pepper.

All the sliders I tried were good. However, the BLT was okay. It's simple, straightforward, but plain. It's better to go with the other sliders unless you're really feeling a BLT. The fried chicken and ground beef were much better. 

Their menu has great options between Specials, Bar Snacks, Apps, Salads, and Sandwiches. Great and friendly service...I'm a fan of The Sycamore. Will definitely be back.
author: Zoran L.

description: I am not a big brunch fan, but this place is lovely to enjoy an inexpensive, delicious meal in an intimate environment. I went with two friends and loved my food and got drunk. It was a very fun afternoon! Would go again!
author: Gurleen B.

description: If you want a fun, lit brunch- go here! It can get a little loud which is fine, just not the best place for intimate convo.
author: Puneet D.

description:
I'm giving two stars not because any of the drinks or food are mediocre, but because of an exchange with one of the bartenders during which my race and name were brought to attention. My name is Pirouz Mehmandoost. I'm an Iranian American, born in Redwood City and raised in the East Bay. I'm used to imbeciles stumbling around the subject of my race because of my brown hair and blue eye (heterochromia, so yes just one), but that doesn't mean I won't call people out.

Here's how it went. He told me my name was confusing, or that he couldn't say it or something. So I responded with, "Oh, it's Pirouz Mehmandoost, yeah it's a Persian name" (just FYI, Persian is an ethnicity, Iranian is a nationality). So he responded with, "Oh, I've seen worse." So y'all know where I'm gonna go with this already- I replied saying, "Well I don't think of names as being better or worse, but yeah... it's ethnic if that's what you mean." He segued by saying that he has an Indian surname but he isn't Indian, and I clearly didn't give a shit at that point. I tipped as I normally would for an 8 buck bar bill and said "thanks, have a good day," because in the end I know that people are more likely than not to treat anyone in a service profession like they are not human.... so why would I care? This is the Bay, y'all. This is the city. Don't bring your ignorance to the front of a business and expect people like me to just let it slide. What awkward, clownish behavior.
author: Pirouz M.

description: I really wanted to like this place. The menu items looked very unique and pretty affordable (and where else has $14 bottomless mimosas!! Unfortunately, I didn't get a chance to try.) I'm a sucker for sweet and savory combos so the pork belly donuts and chicken & waffles looked especially enticing, and the vibe seemed pretty cool. We ordered the Salmon Benedict and Chicken & Waffles (the fact that it was stuffed with ham and cheese was simply irresistible). The waffle was rather stale and not fluffy at all and the portion of chicken was on the measly side, but the flavor was good. The Salmon Benedict was tasty and the pineapple from the Eggs Benedict was very sweet and juicy. I wish the breakfast potatoes had a thicker cut with more oomph to it instead of being thin and sort of insubstantial and we left still a bit hungry. I love the innovative food ideas, but I'm not sure the execution is quite there yet.
author: Naomi J.

description: Whoa whoa WHOA. Is it 1994 and am I grabbing food to sustain me through a Rancid concert at a dingy club? Because this is what this place feels like and it is awesome. I had the sliders which are fun and priced individually, as well as a delicious chocolate stout. There is a patio in the back and the place looks utterly untouched by time. Bring people here when you want them to know you're cool.
author: Xenia S.

description:
Went to The Sycamore for brunch on a Saturday because I had heard good things and it seems like a great deal. However, the service could not have been more rude. A waitress accosted us as we were looking for seating and threatened to kick us out and blacklist us from ever returning - all because my friend thought a waitress handed her a pitcher of mimosa. Hello, it was bottomless, not crazy to think they'd give you the pitcher so they don't have to keep refilling? My friend immediately apologized and the waitress CONTINUED being so unbelievably rude. She was sarcastic, didn't accept my friends apology, and went looking for different waiters to see who had "handed" us the pitcher. We were in shock. Never have I ever been in a restaurant with such terrible customer service. We went back to the bar, and immediately asked for our order to be cancelled and to be refunded. Another waitress did so, but not before grabbing the mimosas out of our hands and aggressively dumping them out, WHILE ROLLING HER EYES. I said that we didn't appreciate being spoken to that way by the other waitress, and got no response. So we walked out. Needless to say, we will never be returning, and we urge you to not even try if you're a human being who would like other people to treat you as such. 

Found a better restaurant down the street anyway.
author: Shannon S.

description:
I give this place 5/5 for the friendly staff and the bottomless mimosas for $14 with orders $8+. You have to order them at the bar first and then the staff comes around often to refill your cup. I swear I couldn't even finish my cup before they came around again. lol. 

Location wise it's convenient to get here since it's only a 3 min walk from 16th mission BART. The place itself is quite cramped though. They have a few tables inside and about 3 picnic tables in the back. We got here around 11AM and it was already packed and by 11:30 people had to stand as they waited for a table. FAIR WARNING: This place only has 1 bathroom so the line can get pretty long, especially when everyone's sipping on those mimosas.

TBH, I thought the food was pretty mediocre. The food menu is pretty simple, but they had their own twist to the items What we got: 

- Pork belly doughnuts ($5.75): I was excited to try this but it was too salty for my taste. It's supposed to have a maple glaze on it but it was basically just covered in plain syrup. These had a nice texture/crunch but they were lacking with how much pork belly was in it. 

- Salmon Benedict ($14): My friend and I ended up splitting this dish but I couldn't even finish my half. The dish tasted waaaay too vinegary and overpowered all the other ingredients in the dish. The home fries and fruit it came with were tasty though. 

- Chicken & Waffles (double for $10.75): My favorite dish of the 3 we got. The dish comes with 2 small pieces of chicken on top, but I though the chicken was overcooked. The waffles had a nice crunch on the outside, but once I tried to cut it the waffle basically split right down the middle where the ham/cheese was. It had a nice balance with the saltiness of the ham and sweetness of the syrup. 

Overall I would come back here again just for the bottomless mimosas since it's a steal compared to other places & they don't limit you to just 2 hours. The food was meh, but i'm down to come back to try their sliders and other menu items.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Food: 3/5 
Service: 4/5
Ambiance: 4/5
Overall: might come back since it's one of the few options in the area but maybe only once in a while when I want something different.

Food: 

Mac and cheese balls - do yourself a favor and get the bacon!  Yum.  These were tasty for sure.

Pulled pork sandwich - the sauce was good but the pulled pork itself was a bit dry.

Service: friendly waitstaff.

Ambiance: it's a local dive bar.  The cool thing is that they actually have a nice patio which is convenient on a warm day.
author: Spencer Q.

description:
The service is really great - friendly, relaxed, welcoming, warm. We went for lunch and had the sliders, with a side of salad. The salad dressing is fennally, green, and herby - so much better than an oily vinegar combo. The blt slider was okay, but with toasted buns, could have been excellent. 

I can see this being a fantastic spot at night to get drinks and soak up the booze with tasty pub fare.
author: Em L.

description:
The Sycamore looks like any other dive from the outside and even as you walk in, but there's some quite surprising substance here. 

Start with the drink offerings, in particular a reasonably large and especially well-curated local draft beer selection. I've enjoyed brews like the Berryessa Common Sense and the Anderson Valley Briney Melon gose. Next, and most surprisingly, are quite some amazing, if intentionally gut-busting, food offerings like the pork belly donuts, the fried mac and cheese balls with bacon, or a variety of sliders. I've been here several times at night, but not for brunch, but just the fact that an otherwise divey place like this can hold its own as a brunch destination speaks quite well of the food here. 

Service is usually prompt and efficient. And don't be turned off by the relatively small, compact space up front. There's more room to spare in the rear.
author: Vincent L.

description:
My friend and I were desperate for bottomless mimosas on a Saturday, but as you know, trying to find a restaurant with bottomless mimosas on a Saturday brunch time is impossible. The lines/wait times are long, the prices are high... It wasn't looking too good for us, until I found this place on yelp. I scrolled through their profile and based on their pictures and reviews, hopefully this would be our last stop that day. 

To our surprise, there was only 3 people ahead of us, and it was about a 30 minute wait which was great considering the other places we called had a 1 hour and a half to 2 hour wait! We wrote our name down and waited to be seated. I guess customers usually can seat themselves in the back, but the patio was closed for idk what reason... 

We were seated in the back which I liked, it was a little more intimate sitting on the bar area. We looked at the menus and the waiter told us that we have to order our food at the bar. I skimmed their menu and seen chicken and waffles, and if you follow me on yelp you would know by now how much love I have for that dish... Of course that's what I ordered! The waffles had cheese and bruschetta in the middle, that's what caught my eye! When I bit into the waffle, it was hard and burnt. The chicken was literally really small, considering it was the half order, the chicken was also really dry... My friend had ordered the carnitas eggs benedict, but instead of having a poached egg, she had her eggs scrambled. She let me have more than a few bites of hers since she was too full. Let me tell you, if I would've known that plate was cooked to perfection, that would've been my first option. Next time I go here, it will be! 

As for the customer service, I felt like the employees met my standards. They were attentive and never missed the chance to refill your glass with mimosas... they're super chill and laid back, which I love! See you guys next time!
author: Adrianna T.

description: Great brunch!  Bottomless mimosas are the way to go. They only have orange juice mimosas but you can bring a bottle of cranberry cocktail and they will do poinsettias!  I have the mix and max sliders.  Pretty good.
author: Andrew W.

description:
I've been here twice, one during SF Beer Week and another time recently when I was in the neighborhood. The place is unassuming, it has a small interior and larger backyard beer garden. 

The draft selection is nice, with some unique picks available. It can be pricey compared to other beer bars in the neighborhood, but the place is kind of a fun stop. The backyard beer patio has mural art and strung up lights, a fun place to sit and enjoy beer and conversation with friends. People smoke on the patio, so if you are sensitive to smoke, this might not be the bar for you. 

I have not tried the food yet, as it has always been a stop on my way to dinner or just for a beer while in the neighborhood.
author: Rebekah T.

description:
Came here for bottomless mimosas and bunch on a Saturday. We got there right when it opened and had our choice of outdoor seating.

It immediately reminded me of Zeitgeist's version of a brunch spot. The vibe, decor, outdoor seating were all similar.

Food, service, and drinks were all OK. I don't think they have a full liquor license which I wish I had realized before I ordered a bloody mary. It had soju in it instead of vodka.

I would be really careful of checking your receipt before you pay, a few people trying to close out were being given a hard time about the minimum for bottomless mimosas ($8 dollars of food, I believe?)
author: Emma B.

description: The chicken and waffle was a disappointment. The waffles were dense and had ham sandwiches between them. The ham was really dry. I ordered the chicken (double order), and the chicken was super dry. The salmon Benedict looked appetizing but was lacking in flavor. The potatoes were soggy but the flavor was there. This place would be good for bottomless mimosa but the food was subpar.
author: Teresa C.

description:
Maybe it was an off day considering the reviews, but if it wasn't for the cool mimosa refill guy I would give this place 2 stars.
Four of us came in on an early Sunday afternoon; it wasn't too crowded and we found seats right away. We all ordered at the same time and paid on one bill. One order (my friend's) came within 15 minutes, which was Carnitas Benedictos. The eggs yolks were hard, which is a no-no for poached eggs. Our other three orders came 30 minutes AFTER that. There shouldn't be that much discrepancy in timing when you order and pay on one bill. 
I also ordered the Carnitas Benedictos and guess what?...the yolks were also hard. Wifey got the chicken and waffles, and the waffles were cooked way too long and were burnt and dry. At this point it's almost an hour after we ordered and wasn't worth our time to complain about the food. We just waited for another mimosa and chalked this one up as a loss... Oh wait, the pork belly donuts were tasty.
author: Keith A.

description:
Note: This is sort of an "old" hipster place, and hate "new" yuppie hipsters which have taken over the Mission. 

They were accepting of me and my slightly overdressed preppy ways, I think because I am sleeved as well. I maybe was the only person sans gauges or facial piercings. 

Came in for a pint while I was waiting for our food tour to start. They had a great little selection of drafts. Some locals and some I hadn't seen before. 

As to the decor, again pretty divey and hipster. My favorite part was the draft handle collection above the bar. The bar is maybe 4 people wide. There is a bit more area to sit around, but not a ton. It seems like a great place to go with a friend before dinner or before going somewhere else. 

They have food apparently but I didn't glance at the menu. I saw some other people eating some fries and other fried items, so I'd expect pretty standard bar food. 

I'd go back if I was in the area and really thirsty, but would happily go elsewhere.
author: Sean M.

description:
This isn't a place where you can expect to get reservations. It was raining this day and we arrived for brunch hour on a Sunday. You basically just need to wait outside the door until someone gets up and you can seat yourself. There is apparently seating outside in a patio, but it was too wet for this that day. 

Once you sit down, you go up to the bar area to place your order. They have unlimited mimosas for $14 with a purchase of $8 or more. 

My friend and I both ordered the chicken and waffles.  The food came out quickly. This was a few weeks ago and I still go into my picture gallery to stare at the picture I took and my mouth waters.  I can't recall the last time I had crispy chicken that was perfection like this. The outside was crispy and the inside was tender. The way I've always imagined crispy chicken to be but have never quite experienced it. It sat on a couple of waffles stuffed with prosciutto and manchego. OMG. And you get maple syrup. OMG. The flavors all melded together were ridiculous. I was starving, so that could contribute to me sounding melodramatic in this post. But it was amazing..

The service was totally friendly and everyone seems so chill but on top of taking care of us customers. Definitely one for the books!
author: Karen G.

description:
My bestie was in town, and wanted to do a bottomless mimosa brunch. Found The Sycamore with their awesome price of $8 bottomless mimosas (with order of entree), and decided to check it out. 

I didn't know that you had to seat yourself, so I apologize to the two ladies from Portland who I walked passed to look for a host/hostess. I didn't realize that there wasn't any, and that you were first in line for a table. 

We didn't have to wait outside in the rain too long for a table. We saw fried chicken and waffles when we sat down, and ordered that with bottomless mimosas. You have to order and pay at the bar, which is why it's important to make sure you get a table. 

The food came out quickly to my surprise. And it is the best fried chicken I have ever had. I can't think of another fried chicken dish that's come close! The chicken was boneless, very crispy on the outside, and moist and juicy on the inside. I'm in awe that it wasn't dry. I assume they brined it for a long time to retain its moisture. The waffles were made with manchego cheese and prosciutto inside. So at first, you see two pieces of chicken and a lot of waffles (with the larger portion option) and it feels like the chicken-waffle ratio is off. But it's actually just right because of the cheese and prosciutto inside the waffle, otherwise having more chicken would be too much. I will be dreaming of this chicken tonight! 

The bottomless mimosas were mostly champagne with a touch of orange juice, which is the best way to make mimosas in my opinion! I was very happy at the end of the meal. 

The Mission is usually sunny, and I would've enjoyed eating this meal outside.  But we were there on a rainy day. The dining area is small, and it's on a slope, so we had to level out the table with some napkins so it would stop tipping to one side. 

I like the divey atmosphere, especially in contrast to the ultra-modern, hipster-industrial look that many brunch places have. It's nice to just grab a bite to eat your local bar full local art and a jukebox.  Oh, which by the way, played awesome music that included Beck, and some 90s alternative. I really want to come back for another bottomless mimosas brunch to try out the sliders.
author: Vira P.

description: The Sycamore hosted a series of tap takeovers during beer week SF. We went to a takeover by the Booth Brewing from Eureka, where they offered five beers on draft (including a very delicious citrusy sour). The bar also has some pretty standard and solid food choices - salads, sandwiches, and fries. The roast beef sandwich offers generous meat and comes with thick cut fries. The overall decor of the place is divey and funky. Especially enjoyed the tap head ceiling decorations and the Bobs burger/Simpson's fan art.
author: D W.

description:
I can not get over how horrible the service and my experience was here. My friend and I a reservation for 16 people for her birthday brunch on Sunday, about a month before. The restaurant called a couple days before to confirm, and I said yes, 16 people.

I got there were with my friend at 10:50 so we could get set up for an 11am reservation. We arrived to find out they put us at an 8 person bench table, next to a party of 10. There was legitimately no way we could all fit there. I went up to the waitstaff and said "there's no way we're all going to fit here." His response: "yeah, you're right" ....... Okay dude, well do something about it!!!!

He said "let me know when the rest of your party arrives" went inside, and then did not come back out. A few minutes later, when it was 11:00am and our party was there, I went back inside and asked him what we were going to be doing. He didn't really have an answer, so I suggested that he ask another party at a more open corner area if they could switch with us. He seemed very annoyed at me for asking, but HELLO, it was 100% the restaurants fault that they did not give us the space we needed for our reservation. A few minutes later, he came outside and asked 3 people to move from the corner, table, which they very kindly did. Unfortunately, there was another group of 3 people also sitting at the corner table, who were not getting up and moving. So after 5 minutes of our party awkward crowding around the area, I had to go BACK inside and ask the waiter if he could please ask those people to move. It was not my responsibility to ask them myself, as it was the restaurants fault that they messed up our reservation and therefore their responsibility to fix it.

The waiter, again very annoyed with me said "give me a few minutes," as if I was being an inconvenience to him. He was never apologetic at how much the restaurant had fucked up our reservation, and was not trying very hard to reconcile it. At this time, it was around 11:30, meaning 30 minutes after our reservation had begun, and we were not yet sitting down. Finally he came out and asked the people if they would move, and they said they would when they were done, but then didn't..... We eventually just had to sit down with them so we could start ordering, and they awkwardly stayed there for about 45 minutes longer. 

The most unfortunate part of this experience was that the food was actually pretty good (I got the roast beef sandwich and tried the salmon Benedict), but because of the horrible service and experience, I would never come back and strongly discourage others from coming back as well.
author: Jenna G.

description:
The food is...not good. Came here for brunch. I got the chicken and waffles which were very sad, flat, and already saturated and mushy with syrup when they brought it to the table. Chicken was not seasoned very well and seemed a little burnt. My friend got the veggie scramble with homestyle fries. The fries weren't very seasoned and were super soft, almost floppy.
We both got bottomless mimosas which had no bubbles. Not sure if they had just been sitting out a while (out of a pitcher) or if the OJ:mimosa ratio was way off.
Also the coffee is self-serve. Do with that info what you will.
Loud house music playing the whole time, dim lighting, and no table service made it seem less like a restaurant and more like a dive bar. Not a place to go for brunch. For anyone. Ever.
The 2nd star is for the staff who were all very friendly.
author: Jill A.

description:
The brunch here is great if you want some biscuits and eggs. They fill your mimosa glass pretty quickly. 

This is definitely a dive bar so don't expect your your dumb Instagram pictures to have clean white lines, exposed wood beams and  plants in the background. 

The biscuit sliders are all I ate and they were amazing. Do it.
author: Brandon M.

description: This place is great. Great food. Great people. Fun games. What more can you ask for. And it's cozy.
author: Robin O.

description:
One of my girlfriend's just moved away and she was doing one last get together before leaving SF. She decided to do brunch at The Sycamore on Saturday, April 30th. She showed up right at 10:30am when they open to grab a spot in the back patio. I was a little delicate from the night before, so I didn't show up until around 11:45am.

One of the reasons she chose The Sycamore was their Bottomless Mimosas ($14 with $8 food order). I wasn't sure if I could drink right then and there, but I actually felt better after having a sip. It's all premixed, so unfortunately you can't control the amount of OJ in the drink. I'm normally not a huge fan of too much juice, but that day, it was okay. They come around with pitchers throughout brunch time to refill your cups, so you're never empty for too long. Since you need to order food in order to get the bottomless, I got the Country Scramble ($13.25): Sausage, Bacon, Mushroom, Sharp Cheddar & Country Gravy. It was good and comforting, but I couldn't really stomach much food at the time.

It can be a little confusing as to where you place your order, but just go to the front bar and place your order there. One of the reasons my gf picked this spot was there's no need to split checks. Everyone just goes up front, orders their own food and pays for it. Good spot for big parties as it takes away from needing to split checks.

So I'd probably give them 4 stars except the bathroom situation is ridiculous. They only have one bathroom for the whole restaurant! Combine bottomless mimosas with one bathroom (for both men and women) and you have a ridiculous line. I almost didn't want to drink too much since I'd have to wait forever for the bathroom! Maybe it's a ploy so people don't take advantage of the bottomless, but they should at least have two bathrooms.

Four stars, but minus one for the lack of restrooms.
author: Elena N.

description: I used to love this place. Fast forward 4 years and this place is now kinda "meh". The sliders are small and dry. I ordered the battered fish which was so thickly battered the actual fish was under cooked. I also ordered the fried chicken slider which needed more sauce as it was over cooked and dry. The only highlight of my visit was that the mac and cheese balls are still as tasty as I remember them, but with all of the other dishes I tried being lackluster there isn't a reason for me to go back anymore.
author: Christine L.

description:
This place gets crowded after 12 pm -- you were warned! I honestly had no real beef with The Sycamore except with how loud it got. On the whole though, a number of minor details prevents me from giving this more than an average rating. 

We came here for the Bottomless Mimosas, which to me seemed a little orange juiced-down (as opposed to "watered-down"...). It was delicious all the same. I also got the salmon benedict that came with quite salty and burned potatoes. The salmon was barely present; the biscuit and benedict were fine. 

I'm giving this 3/5 stars for a 3.5/5 star experience. Basically, I don't think you can go wrong here if you're looking for a boozy, loud brunch, but if they made their drinks stronger, their potatoes less burned, and turned their music system down to a lower volume, I could probably bump this up to 4/5.
author: Julia Y.

description: $14 unlimited mimosas with a $10 food minimum on a Sunday sounded great, until I experienced the service. I entered the Sycamore with 3 black friends. We all ordered our food around the same time. One of them actually ordered with me. I got my food first and expected my friend to get their food right after. People started filling in and got their food before my friends did. We asked about the food 30 mins after I got mine. We waited another 10 mins to ask again. Sycamore's sorry excuse: "we lost the order tickets". Why is it that the only black people didn't get their food when non-blacks were receiving their orders right away? I'm not coming back. I'm not supporting an anti-black, entrifying business hiding behind a "hipster ghetto" face.
author: Channelle J.

description:
Not sure why this place has 4 stars. Upon arrival to this very small cramped establishment, we stood at the bar a little confused because no one come over to assist us, give us a wait time, take our names, or anything. The girl at the bar finally said, "what do you want? Are you eating? Getting drinks? What?" 

Then finally another gentleman gave us the schpeal and menus. No seats at the back patio or inside were available. So we came back in willing to sit at the bar. The same girl said, "you need to move and split the corner of the bar because this is where we set our food to be taken out." 
........
So after that, we were done with the rude attitude of the woman and the restaurant. We found another spot in The Mission about a 3 minute walk away for brunch with better food, better service, and better bottomless mimosas. Won't ever be returning here. 

Bye!
author: Kahfii K.

description: Went here on a nice warm Sunday morning expecting to sit in the patio but unfortunately it was closed due to some legal barriers. The seating area was pretty small and the warm inside. There were some games to play while you got your bottomless drank on except it wasn't really bottomless. The squad and I had to wait a few times to get refills on our drinks. The employees there however are amazing (shouts to Zane). They are really friendly and totally down to earth!
author: Navdeep D.

description: Small bar with board games. They do heavy pours of wine. Staff is friendly. Didn't have any food but it looked good.
author: Matthew P.

description:
This bar reminds me of a place I'd find in Austin, Texas. They have a GREAT music selection. It was probably one of the best music selections of a bar I've been to in a long time. If you like dive bars, check this one out! 

I heard about this place from a friend of mine who lives in San Francisco. We wanted to find a great brunch place. And this place has bottomless mimosas for $12! (With a purchase of $8 food) There brunch menu is served Saturday's and Sunday's from 10 am-3pm. 

Our waitress was great about filling up the mimosas and never letting us go dry. The line was pretty long, it took us awhile to place our order with the bar tender (all orders food and drink have to be done with the bar tender), our food took awhile... But they have a bunch of board games. We played Apples to Apples while we waited for our food. They have outside seating, picnic style tables and it was pretty crowded when we went out there. 

Pros: great music selection, nice staff, cool hipster/dive bar, board games galore 

Cons: serve yourself your own coffee and water, food takes awhile, crowded, pricey for a dive bar 

Tip**: Their bloody Mary's were delicious! They have a few vegetarian options for brunch. I order the veggie Benedict and it was great! The bar tender announced a little bit after I ordered it that they were all out of the veggie Benedict and couldn't make anymore. I'd say the earlier, the better for Sunday brunch. 

Tip***: a lot of people I spoke to in this bar told me they were ordering the Smoked Salmon Benedict. I heard it's great and very popular!
author: Carly E.

description: Great brunch place, with creative items at a good price, and bottomless mimosas! I had the carnitas benedict, which was really delicious. Unfortunately, they ran out of chicken and waffles by the time I got there, hoping this isn't a regular thing and that I get some next time! Mimosas are also really good, though surprisingly strong, so watch out for any of your lightweight friends :)
author: Max P.

description: Great bartenders and good bar food. A divey feel with a cool atmosphere. Dont leave without getting the fries! I also recommend the jalapeno poppers
author: Lyndon G.

description:
This place would improve for more attentive staff. The food was pretty good, but the place wasn't really clean, the tables weren't wiped down. And the layout is incredibly crowded and awkward.

I had the sliders, which were decent enough, and my friend really enjoyed the granola. Next time around, I might try enjoying the bottomless mimosas.
author: Brian K.

description:
Stumbled upon this place on a Sunday morning while on the hunt for bottomless mimosas that didn't come with a 2+ hour wait. When you first enter, the restaurant seems TINY, like 20 seats max? Though small, the interior has a cool vibe, with neat decor around the bar and old school board games for customers to play. We ended up on the back patio, which had covered open seating. 

The menu's pretty simple and you order everything at the bar. Majority our group opted for the chicken & waffles, which looked amazing when they came out. The chicken was good and had a nice crunch, but the waffles themselves were literally drowning in syrup and way too sweet for my liking. They stuff the waffles with ham (I think to try and balance out the sweetness) but overall I just wasn't a fan. 

The mimosas were good and cheap, but there's definitely other places with bottomless mimosas of equal price/quality that have much better food than this place.
author: Alyson A.

description: Casual brunch spot with delicious food. The food came fast, and the service was great. We got the vegetable, goat cheese scramble and the smoked salmon benedict. Both were good and the side potatoes were fantastic. I wish the patio would have been open, so hopefully the construction is done soon. They also had great brunch / drink specials that a lot of the tables were ordering!
author: Kayla F.

description:
Came for brunch! Real reason: Bottomless mimosas in Mission. 

FOOD: Friends ordered chicken and waffles and I ordered the biscuit sandwiches one with egg & another with chicken. Their chicken and waffles dish features strawberries! Personally, I love  strawberries so had I known.. I would've ordered the same! It seems weird but the strawberries added to the sweet side of the dish and complimented the waffles but surprising paired well with the chicken! Their chicken wasn't super moist but it had a nice crunch with good spices rolled in. I'd ordered this for myself next time! As for the biscuit sandwiches, I don't normally like biscuits but Sycamore's was light, fluffy, & buttery. I enjoyed the biscuit with chicken! Fries are a good side for these guys but a good side of fruit will do too!

SERVICE: One of my friends had a bit of a complicated order but I appreciate their patience! Also, my mimosa glass never went dry nor did my drink ever reach the bottom. They're good about that. 

Top hit:

- You, my friend, are right next to Clarion Alley which is a nice stroll afterwards.

Heads up(s): 

- They do have a rooftop area for brunch but it was packed by the time we got in line. So come early! (This was also a Sunday)
author: Julienne D.

description: The Sycamore is a lovely neighborhood bar. They have a modest selection of beer and wine and boast a cozy atmosphere. It also has some of the most underrated food in the city. I highly recommend the mix & match sliders-- especially the fried chicken. From what I can tell the chicken patties are fresh prepared and fried (not frozen). They also make delicious and well-dressed salads.
author: Carson S.

description: Spent a sunny Saturday afternoon on their lovely terrace. My friend and I ordered bottomless mimosas, and boy was it actually bottomless! I never got a chance to even finish my glass before it was refilled. The food was pretty good considering the price. The only thing I would suggest would be to have a more organized system of getting food to the customers. I didn't hear my name being called which resulted in the guy walking around in circles looking for me. The number system might be better ? Overall, highly recommend !!
author: Mandy G.

description:
The staff Definitely Not here for the Hospitality 

The guy was very quick at seating us I'll give him that so with that move it gave me high hopes well was I wrong   For a restaurant they really don't do anything you have to prepay then as I did wanted water it's get your own glass do it yourself we asked for salt and pepper and got its over there so if you want it you can get it  I wanted OJ with breakfast and it's 4 bucks a glass non refillable I said ok thinking it was perhaps fresh or even a high priced brand lol nope it was the 1.89 a gallon after letting her know I was just going with water I received a gracious EYEROLL then my colleague was asking what a particular item was and the gentlemen who originally was great then gave her a extremely caddy I don't know with an eyeroll  I'm hoping eyerolls are a part of their establishment part of their dress code maybe  they are really rolling them out well  you would think with your online menu and your in house menu not being the same u might let us know but when we inquired about the pricing we're told we don't honor it rudely Long story short don't waste your time food sucks service sucks definitely not coming back nor recommending this place  the picture of the menu is what they won't honor since in house they've increased their prices
author: Jae A.

description: Takes too long to fill the bottomless mimosas. Otherwise great service, good food, would come back
author: Abhay D.

description:
My boyfriends and I stumbled upon this little gem while we were in the area. We needed a little food and drinks before we went out for the night and we were so happy we found this place.

We split a basket of French Fries, Fried Mac 'n' Cheese (with jalepeno and bacon), BLT Slider (bacon, butter lettuce, tomatoes and smoked paprika aioli), Lamb Slider (ground lamb, caramelized onions, romesco aioli and manchego cheese), and Fried Chicken Slider (chicken breast with pickled red onion, slaw and roasted garlic aioli). It was the perfect amount of food. We didn't go too overboard, but I think we could have gotten one more slider without feeling overly full.

They also had a good variety of beers, but everyone was ordering cheap beers in a can. I guess that's their special. The only problem that I had was that you had to order the food at the bar, but it was hard to get there because everyone was trying to order drink and there was only 1 bartender. I think it would have been easier for everyone if they had a server.
author: Theo T.

description: The Sycamore is amazing. Great dive bar brunch place.  Just check out the menu and be amazed.
author: Jim C.

description:
*** In Short ***

Dive bar with tasty bites. Both food and drink must be ordered at the bar.

*** In Depth ***

I don't do dive bars: it's not really my thing. When I drink, I go out for fancy cocktails I can't, or am too lazy to make at home. So, you can probably guess that I wasn't at the Sycamore for the drinks - in fact, I had no idea it even was a dive! So yes, my friend and I came for their food. And yes, we may or may not have already eaten previously.

After figuring out that everything needed to be ordered at the bar, we put in for an order of their fried mac n cheese bites, as well as their pork belly doughnuts. Friend got a beer, while I got a glass of rose. The latter? Terrible idea, and not particularly enjoyable. The former(s)? Fantastic idea, and both were super tasty.

***Accessibility Info***

Venue - The place was fairly crowded at the bar and beyond, so I can't speak for the venue beyond the little area up front, which accessible enough in that it had standard height tables. The bar is, of course, a high top bar, so that is what it is.

Bathroom - Didn't use.
author: Johnny W.

description: WTF, WTF, WTF, they served me a beer in a wine glass. Not a 10oz Belgian goblet but an actual longstem white wine glass. This is during SF beer week and charging $8+ for an 8 ounce wine glass. A 4 pour flight was 20 bucks. It feels more like a bad clubhouse for friends than an actual bar. Staff seemed overwhelmed and not very professional. The most douchian place ever. We went to Rosamunde for a sausage and a proper pint.
author: M. D.

description: Their pizza dipped in ranch and deep fried is to die for! Yummy!!!!!! I would go here everyday if I was a millionaire.
author: Dee D.

description: Love this place, love the mimosa lady, need I say more? Great food, good vibe....hand may a birthdays and lost Sunday's here.
author: Jen B.

description: I had probably the worst treatment i've ever had in my life from and extremely rude and aggressive worker.  Just prior to closing time ( of which we were not told ) we bought drinks only to a few minutes later have our drinks agrresively ripped out of our hands and poured out.  Obviously communication is not a 1st option  at this establishment but violent rude behavior is.
author: Nala F.

description:
This review is solely based on atmosphere of brunch at 12:30 on a Saturday, since we never got to eat. First the whole street smells like pee, so that smells follows into the bar (not a great start). The place was pretty packed and the hallway to get to the back patio is also the route the employees take to get to the kitchen or bar and is also the line for the restrooms. We made our way to the back patio to look for seating (nothing) but a guy lets us know they are about to leave and we could have their seat, awesome. When their group gets up a leave a girl approaches the table and asks if they are leaving (as she's already starting to sit down at the table) the guy explains he already offered it to us and we are (nicely) waiting for them to leave. Her response? "I was here first" like a first grader...her "squad" then proceeds to swarm the table. We asked if we could sit at the end of the table that they weren't using (because it was in the sun) and she proceed to push her purse on the seat a little further down and in the most bitchy tone says "we have more people coming and don't want YOU to crowd US" 
So long story short, we left. The smell of pee and bitchy girls reliving their long forgotten sorority days are not my cup of tea..
author: Maddie D.

description: Awesome location in the mission for sunday brunch. I go to are the chicken and waffles, lamb sliders, and the benedict. Who can say no to the bottomless mimosas to start the funday. You have to be there real early (before noon) for the chicken and waffles.
author: David Dat T.

description:
Basing my review off both a brunch and happy hour experience.

Food: Brunch food is pretty good, but not amazing. I got the eggs benedict, which was really yummy, but also I feel like is pretty standard and hard to mess up. The bar snacks are delicious! We got the fries (seasoned perfectly - enough but not too much), mac and cheese fritters (the best thing we ordered - that jalapeno is just too good), kale dip, and the artichoke. We ended up getting a second order of fries. Portions were decent too, which was nice as we were splitting the items among 5 colleagues. Each item was ~$6-9, which was what I expected. 

Service: Brunch was super busy, and full of drunk, obnoxious people. I recommend being prepared for that kind of scene. Staff seemed to be doing the best they could. Coming for happy hour was a really pleasant experience. The bartender was really sweet and helpful, even accommodating a specific request I had regarding payment for our order. 

Note: you order both food and drinks at the bar, they don't take your order at the table. Convenient for splitting checks. Not sure how they know where the food goes, but they do which is awesome!

Drinks: Extensive beer menu with quite a few on tap. Got to try a few new things which was nice. The bottomless mimosas were actually $16. They come around to refill often enough for our table. I was typically empty already but my friends weren't so it appears to be a personal problem (oops.. lol).

The patio out back is nice with lots of seating, and you can also smoke there. Overall, dive bar combined with hipster/gentrification vibes, with decent food and a great beer selection to match. I'd come here for happy hour over brunch.
author: Neda S.

description: The rudest place I have ever gone too!! Literally went in there for brunch with my boyfriend a while back, not only was nobody serving us turned out to be self service basically but Lethe atmosphere was weird, the lady was upset we broke her conversation. And we asked "where do we get menus" her response was well before that you can start by closing my door and then come to counter when you're ready. And then went back to conversation with her friend we left immediately
author: Michelle M.

description: Amazing staff! Everyone was amazing and friendly go there for brunch you won't be disappointed, Charlie (charbie) is awesome!
author: Shelby T.

description:
Okay portions but the food is delish! We ordered their famous chicken and waffles, and smoked salmon scramble and they were both perfect in taste and texture. Like I said, the portions were only okay just because the portions were on the smaller side.

But what made up for it was their bottomless mimosas! At $14, you get a guy who comes by and refills your cup every 15 minutes. The mimosas were tasty but strong. Definitely would come back if I wanted to have a good time in SF.
author: Tiffany W.

description: This is always my go to place for brunch on the weekend. Brunch hours Saturday-Sunday 10-3. Bottomless mimosas with $8+ food purchase. I love the mimosas here. It is sweet and strong. The food here is super delicious. I definitely recommend the chicken and waffles, pork belly donuts, pull pork sandwiches, and the salmon scrambles/Benedict.
author: Huong L.

description: A great spot to grab a beer and food. That staff is amazing, and the outdoor area is a nice spot to grab a drink. They have a good selection of beers on tap, and the employees know their stuff.
author: Nate K.

description:
Have come here about 8 times for brunch/breakfast first off one of my favorite bloody Mary's in SF!

And hallelujah for someone actually have good biscuits and gravy in SF! Midwest raised I was about to open my own restaurant for BnG in the city.  Of course you have to get the pork belly donuts, chicken and waffles are great as well. This little place packs a punch!
author: Morgan S.

description: Solid spot in the Mission to catch a bit of sunshine on the back patio and sip some good beers.  Walking in the place is kinda dark and small but head towards the back and the patio is a nice size with picnic tables, benches and some umbrellas for shade.  Didn't get  a chance to try the food but it looked pretty good (typical bar fare of sandwiches, fries, etc) Happy hour includes $1 off drafts daily from 4-7 woooo!
author: Kelsey B.

description:
Brunching in San Francisco! Was very excited for The Sycamore since it was to be my first brunch experience in San Fran. Came away with mixed feelings. Its a cozy little place in Mission which was packed because of the lovely weekend weather. They have some seating facing the street in the front and a patio at the back. The patio was bursting at the seams and we were lucky to commandeer the only empty table in the front.

The decor was interesting, sofas combined with mismatched chairs gave it a cool, rustic sort of appearance. They had only 1 bathroom which was kind of a pain because the place was jam packed. Regular American brunch fare at prices that I suppose are par for the course in SFO. You can add bottomless mimosas for a little bit extra.

The food itself was quite good, I had a veggie burger which hit the spot and everyone else at the table seemed to enjoy their meal as well. The service was very sub par. Firstly, the food took reallllly long to come out (which I can understand since they were packed). However, the guy who was to be replenishing our supposedly bottomless mimosas was nowhere to be found for the most part. We kept having to go to the bar for refills which seemed to annoy the bartender who rudely instructed us to wait on the missing mimosa man. When said missing mimosa man finally showed up, he tried to show off some pouring skills but ony succeeded in pouring the drinks onto the table and down someone's pants, instead of into the glasses. The guy was either completely wasted or just incredibly bad at his job. 3 stars because the food was good and the vibe was chill but they need to up their service game.

Breakdown:
Food - 4/5
Setting - 3/5
Drinks - 3/5
Service - 2/5
author: Varun D.

description: Love this place. The have has bottomless mimosas and amazing pork donut! Extra points for all the board games and the back patio!
author: Ibelig V.

description: I wanted to do the full Mission District experience, and I couldn't do it without starting with brunch. I Googled brunch spots in SF, and this was the first one to appear. I came with 2 of my friends and was seated immediately, on a Saturday. A small, trendy, vibey spot to enjoy brunch and of course bottomless mimosas. You order at the bar area, and they serve you your first mimosa there. Kim, our awesome server, came around to fill up my glass. She'd come and fill up even when my glass was half way full....that's what I'm talking about! I ordered the salmon benedict, and it was sooo good. Now I'm not the type who orders benedicts but I might be a fan now after eating here. I highly recommend coming here for brunch. If you are visiting SF, Dolores Park is walking distance from this spot. It's a win :)
author: Elsie C.

description: It's a great chill bar where you can come with your larger group and sit down and enjoy a beer and play old school boardgames. Theres seating in the back patio for larger groups. The beer selection is great. If you want to play one of the more favorite games, such as cards against humanity, you need to hand over you ID as collateral.
author: Samantha E.

description: Looks like a typical pub inside, but my scallops were fabulous and I would compare to Ocean Club quality.  They suggested a drink for me that was not on the menu because I like umbrella drinks, and it was wonderful.  I can't wait to return!
author: Tracy P.

description:
Had the opportunity to drown myself with bottomless mimosas this weekend! 

This place is tiny and always packed. In the front of the restaurant are a few tables, but there is an outdoor space that has much more seating. I would recommend coming with a part of 6 or less. I had 6 and it was more than difficult to find seating. One thing I liked about The Sycamore is that you order at the bar and just go find a seat, which means you don't have to worry about splitting the check with frands or family. 

Bottomless Mimosas are 14 dollars (w/ purchase of an entree that is $8 or more). I would have to say that it was worth it since they were always quick to fill our cups. The food on the other hand was mediocre at best. Here are my thoughts! 

Breakfast Chicken Slider - Chicken was nice and crispy, but my friends kept telling me how salty it was! Maybe I was a tad buzzed, but I didn't believe them until I kept eating it. I am hoping it was just the batch they had made.

Fried Egg Slider - Same as the breakfast chicken, the biscuit for this was way too salty. The egg yolk was nice and runny though. If it weren't for the biscuit, they paired nicely with the mimosas. 

Biscuit & Gravy - Very heavy and thick! I think if you want something filling, this would be a good option to get as well. Nothing too special, but of course the mimosas made it decent.

Overall, this place is a great option to get bottomless mimosas. Being in cramp spaces isn't the best feeling, but hey.. we are in SF, what do you expect? The waiters are fast with the mimosas and its a great place to just enjoy and catch up with friends. Definitely try it out!
author: Matthew D.

description: came here for my friend's birthday and was surprised that there was no wait! there's a lot of outdoor space but only a few indoor tables. to get bottomless mimosas you need to spend at least $10 worth of food to get it. that's not a probably since their dishes were very affordable and only $10-$15! i got their smoked salmon benedict and it was soooo good. i loved that they gave you a fruit cup and potatoes! usually you would need to choose between those. of course all of us also got the bottomless and i could tell it was kind of watered down? but no biggie, it did it's job and we all got pretty tipsy from it! you gotta order at the bar first before you sit though!
author: diane d.

description: For the price, it shouldn't be self-serve. It's Berkeley style environment is nice and all but I just wasn't feeling it for brunch. Just over-fried potatoes in a bar. The staff were nice but the food was just not good.
author: Darcie W.

description: I'm a huge fan of the bottomless mimosas and down to earth breakfast fare. Plus, the patio is dog friendly and they lovingly provide sunscreen for the sunny days!
author: Allison H.

description:
Really cool brunch spot! It's located in the Mission and I must say, FINALLY bottomless mimosas that is not $20. If you come here for brunch, they offer bottomless mimosas for $8 with an entree, which isn't bad at all! 

What's unique about this place is not just cheap mimosas but they have an outdoor patio with lots of board games options such as monopoly, cranium, cards against humanity, and many more! I would definitely come back to this place. The mimosas guy named Charlie is the best! Very funny guy.

Sycamore Chicken and Waffles and Carnitas Benedictos = VERY GOOD.
author: Jenn L.

description: The bartender was rude. The service was awkward and unhelpful. And the menu is very small with minimal basic options.
author: Mia M.

description:
I'm only responding re: the food because I don't drink, but I was impressed by the enormous selection of drink options.

I found the food pretty darned tasty, but kinda hit or miss. I was here in the evening, so no brunch guidance here.

Grilled Cheese + Tomato soup left me underwhelmed. The soup part was probably the least satisfactory.

Their french fries, on the other hand, are perfect. I don't know if I've had much better fries yet in the city!
author: B C.

description:
I'm not sure how a dive bar can be pretentious, but this one certainly nails it.
All of the food is fried, the drinks are limited, and the service is slow. But if you want to spend the evening playing board games with a bunch of hipsters, you've found your Nirvana
author: Alison H.

description: Wow talk about a bang for your buck!! $15 for a a full rack of waffles and fried chicken! I'm talking about 1 waffle the size of an ego waffle cut into 4 pieces and 2 slices of chicken from a McChicken cut horizontally in half. Then drench it with some industrial syrup and pop some blueberries in that bad boy! For $15 I couldn't pass it up. Where can I spend that little on such huge portions? I'm glad I found a new chicken and waffle place. This is up there with my other favorites like Waffle House or the frozen section of luckys or Safeway
author: Frank C.

description:
Amazing place for beer week! Personally, I love dive bars, but this dive bar is something special because they have such a nice outdoor patio and many beer specials! Even for beer week they had an all goose island night, but they also have other breweries host different nights! This is a great place to chill for a night or have a social pre game! The decor and board games are also a huge plus! 

Huge kudos to the server who replaced my tray of beers after they fell off the table! You know a place has great service when they treat the customer first! Thank you so much again for a great time! Can't wait to come again!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
This place is really really small, even given the back patio space. It honestly almost makes me not like going there, but I keep coming back because the beer and the food is really good. Just prepare for a hyper stressful time trying to find a place to sit or even stand.

If dive bars are your thing though, this is definitely for you!
author: Kristen T.

description:
First time in was on Christmas Eve. The place isn't what I would call welcoming from the outside, but once we were inside I was pleasantly surprised. The staff and other patrons were very friendly. We order our drinks and then reviewed the dinner menu. There is quite the selection on the menu. We went with the beef sliders, fried Brussels sprouts, and the famous roast beef sandwich. We were really happy with the meal. The sliders were amazing.

The interior is rather dark but comfortable with a small L shaped bar. If you take the hallway towards the back of the building you will discover the out bier garden. This was well lit and had several tables.

We will definitely be back!
author: John G.

description:
I had high hopes for this dive bar and its food, but it didn't quite pull through. The place is dark and slanted, literally. Our meal was eaten on a slope, which was rather strange. All of the cushions on the booth side were horribly cracked and torn. They were very uncomfortable to sit on while wearing a skirt. 

We ordered the pork belly donuts to share, and I got two sliders and fries -- the fried chicken and beef. My friend got the lamb slider with fries. Although she enjoyed her meal, I was dissatisfied. The fries were overly salted, and the sliders were quite flavorless. Also, the pork belly wasn't pork belly at all, both of us agreed. It was pork, but more like something stewed, not reminiscent of belly in the slightest.
author: Lisa S.

description: Great place for a few beers and some feel-good food. Solid patio, though it generally gets quite crowded. GREAT beer selection. Also, points for the barn door.
author: Aaron A.

description:
The staff are so nice. As a super popular bar innthenmisdion, they could afford to be assholes. They are not. These guys and gals are the friendliest people, and will serve yoy a good drink or meal. 

Other perks, board games, good patio, amazing brunch.
author: Alek C.

description:
This place is rather ... interesting.

The delicious food pics on Yelp drew us in, and we expected more of a gastropub environment, but it's definitely more of a dive bar type of atmosphere - dimly lit, warped tables and chairs, juke box, board games - but with above average pub eats.  

Order the mac 'n' cheese, gourmet sliders - get the lamb and skip the fried chicken. 

Beer on tap was a quality selection and the barkeep was able to suggest a beer to my liking. And they have hard root beer. I never had it until then. Try it!
author: Farrah A.

description: Tasty bar food, chill vibes. Nice casual spot. The donuts are delicious, not as sweet as you might expect.
author: Becca O.

description: went while their patio was closed down, so it was tight inside the restaurant. the need to go up to the counter to order wasn't clear, so we sat for a bit. staff was overall attentive with the mimosa refills, and they were nice when the crowd started to grow and they needed our seats. the chicken and waffles was good. great idea to have the waffle stuffed. the best parts of this dish were the chicken and the syrup though. the carnitas Benedict was disappointing, tasted more like Reuben meat and the hollandaise was not well connected to the dish. Overall felt satisfied because the price was good, but the food could improve.
author: Mal C.

description: Probably one of my favorite loud brunch places with great bottomless mimosas, food and a good time !
author: C D.

description:
(^_^) Mix 'n' Match Slidos: Don't mix or match - just get em all. #eatallthefoods

(-_-) Reuben Burger: Daily special. Would've preferred it as a slider.

(-_-) Pork Belly Donuts: Wanted less salty more sweet. Bucket list, check.

(^_^) Cards Against Humanity, Simpsons, Cranium, Trivial Pursuit, et al: Do it.

3 1/2?
author: Dan B.

description:
This place reminds me of home :) It's a small bar with some tables, a friendly bartender, and a few solid munchies at an affordable price.

The boyfriend and I ordered our food and beer at the bar, and took our seats.

First up, the pork belly donuts ($5.75 for 3). They were salty and savory, but also very sweet. They were really neat, but not sure if it warrants ordering again if we ever return.

We also got some bacon jalapeno poppers which were all very crispy and exactly as you'd hope they would taste.

Next up, sliders. We had the lamb ($4.25) and beef w/ blue cheese, and while they were on the smaller side, they were still good.

This place was pretty chill overall, and one of the few I'd want to come back to whenever we're in SF. They don't have too many taps (bummer), but there's a lot more of that menu I want to try!
author: Michelle H.

description:
Great patio for bottomless mimosas on a sunny day! 

The back patio is first come first served seating so it's great if your there early and claim a spot. 

I had the breakfast sliders and also tried the fried chicken and waffles. All delicious!
author: Daniela J.

description: A good little dive bar like place. Nothing too special but a fun place to hang out low key with your friends. The patio was closed unfortunately but I hear it's nice!
author: Ronak M.

description: The venue was a little louder than I had expected which I did not really like for a brunch setting. I didn't like the outside area though which was perfect for a sunny day. The food arrived pretty quickly--my friend ordered a veggie scramble which was pretty small considering the price ($13). The side potatoes were delicious though. If you are independent and enjoy really loud places where you have to shout to have a conversation then yes, Sycamore is a great place. And what I mean by independent is that no one is going to come refill your coffee.
author: Katherine L.

description:
Not a fan of the pork belly donuts. Grease grease fat, more grease. It's pretty much was like balls of deep fried lard.
I know many Yelpers will disagree with me but I don't give a sh1t. You know what? I'm also not a fan of David Chang's pork belly buns for the same reasons. I know it's pork belly but damn, there was just way too much fat. 

Love the extensive beer selection and fries though. Fries are crispy the way I like em. 
Oh and Bingo nights are fun.
author: Susy C.

description: After getting there at 11, only 1 of 4 people in our party were served by 12pm. The people in my party that had our "tickets forgotten" were all black. They served every single white person on the patio even though these people got to the restaurant after us, and they still didn't once come to check to on us. If you are black, just expect not to be served.
author: Nicki H.

description:
Zane the bartender/server is amazing!!! His customer service is beyond superb. It was a long wait to sit but it was so worth it. The bottomless mimosas were $14 with a purchase of at least $8 worth of food, just for clarity. Also keep in mind that the country gravy does have pork sausage, I wasn't aware, and I don't eat pork so those were the only real downfalls for me. Everything else was beyond great! The food, the people and the atmosphere.

I had the chicken biscuit breakfast slider, breakfast potatoes and fruit. My friends had the smoked salmon eggs benedict, and the bacon breakfast slider. The food was really good!

My friends and I had a good time, thanks to The Sycamore team :)
author: Ico O.

description:
This review is for the brunch as that is the only time I have visited. This atmosphere is awesome. I love the homie, hole in the wall feel of this place. I also love the outdoor seating out back. They have board games which is so needed on hungover laid back mornings. 

The food is not my absolute fav so that is the reason for one less star but the atmosphere and staff keep me coming back. The bartender is a multitasking queen. Also, they keep on top of filling your bottomless. 

Def recommend if you are looking for a laid back start to you day.
author: Jennifer A.

description: Friendly staff really cool vibe. We went around 11am and there was a wait but we didnt have to wait long. They have a seat yourself policy. I ordered the bean burger and it was the best ive tasted in a long time! It is surrounded by rich culture and the best part ofcourse is- bottomleas mimosas!
author: Amrita S.

description: Went back again because my first time here was so awesome. Can't say the same about round 2. I ordered the country scramble but the potatoes were severely undercooked. The mimosas were ok but something was off with either the food or alcohol because I ended up throwing up until 11 PM that evening. Say what you will that I wasn't able to handle my alcohol but I feel qualified to say that as a seasoned alcoholic this was a very distressing and bizarre experience.
author: Helen F.

description: Located in a less than savory area of the Mission is The Sycamore. While it was a fun place to escape the crowd of the Warriors game, I don't think I would go back. The atmosphere was a little too dark and quaint for my liking, but that might be some people's thing. The beer selection was great and the prices were affordable. I would recommend to anyone who wants to escape the "hip" bars of the Mission and wants to just get a nice cold beer.
author: Kaitlyn F.

description:
I was shopping across the street with a friend, when we decided to get an early lunch somewhere in the Mission. I checked Yelp and I had actually bookmarked The Sycamore already so we decided to come here. We checked the outside patio, but decided to sit inside. 
$14 bottomless mimosa with $8 food purchase!
Food was a bit salty, but the music, people, and mimosas were great so I can't complain! They also have tons of games to play and amazing art for sale. Will be back to sit out on the patio for sure.
author: Cheyenne N.

description: Dirty patio with nice graffiti on the walls, where you can smoke if you want to. That patio is big for big groups as they have communal tables. Not very impressed with this place and even less with the unclean bathroom, but on the bright side their mimosas are for real (check the amount of boxes of champagne in the patio).
author: Carmen V.

description: I always go to The Sycamore when I'm in the Mission.  I started coming here years ago with a bunch of friends for a birthday and haven't stopped since.  Found my favorite all time beer on draft here (Ballast Point Indra Kunindra) and it was a perfect match for their Lamb Slider with Manchego cheese... The brunch here is amazing and always busy.  Highly recommend the patio area if you are with a bunch of friends.  Bottomless Mimosas are a great deal just be sure to order food and make the minimum.  Also - only has 1 restroom so be prepared.
author: Aaron H.

description: Worst service ever.  Be careful. Don't leave your credit/debit card without closing your tab.yours there they'll charge you tip.  The chubby lady at the front wouldn't explain to me why I was charged tip, etc...without my signature on the paper.  I obviously didn't authorize that but instead she kicked me out.
author: Danial A.

description:
We were a group of 6 coming in to brunch on March 5 and we had the weirdest dining experience ever.

1 dish came in about 20 mins - yay, right? Then 20 minutes later, 1 other dish arrived - weird, usually they try to bring all orders at the same time, but ok.. 

Then nothing. FOR HOURS. 

We were a bunch of friends who hadn't seen each other in awhile so even though we were hungry, we didn't mind the delay at first because we were just catching up. But at some point we realised that there's gotta be something going on. All of the other tables were getting restless as well. 

Around 12:30 or so a friend of ours went inside to check and saw our waiter screaming at someone telling him to 'get the f*** out' - so he refrained from asking about our order. There seemed to be no point anyway since it was obvious that it wasn't because they forgot, the kitchen was simply not making food. We weren't the only table waiting for our order.

Around 1:30pm, the same waiter went out to the patio out to make an announcement basically saying "your meal is coming, stop asking the bartender, there's a shenanigan going on, we're sorry" - he didn't go into details about what the shenanigans were about.

Finally around 2 pm - close to 3 hours after we arrived, more of our dishes came out. By the time we left, close to 3pm, my order - a simple fried egg slider - still hasn't come. So I cancelled it.

So here's the thing. I totally understand that things happen at restaurants. But for the price Sycamore is charging, I was expecting them to handle "shenanigans" in classier manner. There was no explanation, no attempt to remedy the situation, no offer for a refund, there was no acknowledgement that we'd been waiting for our food for 3.5 hours. A little explanation of the situation would do much in garnering empathy. Or how about an offer of free mimosas during the 3 hour wait?
