author: Anand J.

description:
I feel like if it were 1960 this is the place where a bunch of kids would get together to later go on and form either an amazing rock band, fashion a Dead Poets Society, or start a cult. 

I really love writing here. I also really love the food. I also absolutely adore the bartenders. The patio is clutch. The brunch is clutch. So basically clutch yourself a good old time. 

I do really wish that they served booze. If Sycamore had whiskey - well. I'd move in.
author: Ryley P.

description:
So - I didn't realize Sycamore was a dive bar before I planned on taking my boyfriend and his parents there for lunch one day.

Luckily - his parents are not offended by people smoking pot in public or it would have been a disaster.

His Vegetarian Mom: loved her black bean burger.
His Dad: Loved all three sliders he had. 
The pork belly donuts were amazing although they needed a little bit more salt. 
I like my pulled pork sandwich but my boyfriend's roast beef was really really good. The fries were delicious.

The food came out fast and the beer was cold. 

Bonus: the outdoor patio is really nice on sunny days (they also have shade if you don't want to sit directly in the sun). I would totally go to Sycamore again!
author: Alex W.

description: Really laid back environment. Very friendly staff and the food was excellent! Ordered the chicken and waffles, very happy with that! The staff was very attentive with filling the bottomless mimosas too!! There's also board games to play when you start to get tipsy and have some fun! Only downside is one bathroom
author: Allysia R.

description:
The Sycamore rocked my world today. I love the dark red, divey feel, and the vintage '80s/goth music playing this morning was fantastic. Totally empty when I arrived a little before 11, jam packed by noon. 

Awesome pork belly doughnuts, and the bottomless mimosas lived up to their billing; my glass was never empty. My carnitas Benedict tasted great, but the poached eggs were way over cooked, more soft-boiled really. 

This place reminds me of the San Francisco I used to live in and love. Though I'm a proud Oaklander now, I felt nostalgic today. Thank you, Sycamore.
author: Leslie S.

description: I usually feel that for brunch you can have one or the other. Bottomless mimosas, or good food. This is the one place you don't have to sacrifice. Not to mention that I never make it to the bottom of my mimosas before my mimoset comes around.
author: J A.

description:
Pretty sweet dive bar with legit beer selection. My partner and I happened by this place while in the neighborhood and stopped by for an afternoon drink. They have beers on tap that I've never really seen before in the city. I had the a Belgian Pale Ale (I think it was from the Marin Brewing Company), and my partner got the Headlands RyePA. The Belgian had wonderful, smooth flavors, though it had a lighter flavor profile than I expected. However, when I tried my partner's RyePA, I loved it immediately. It was hoppy and you can taste the rye in the beer. 

We took our drinks out to the back patio, smoking area. It's a fairly small open area packed with picnic tables. If seating is limited, you just need to ask to share a table and people are pretty accommodating. There's some pretty cool murals back there as well. This is a cool spot. I'll definitely come back here sometime :)
author: Gina I.

description:
I was a little concerned about The Sycamore due to the neighborhood. At first I thought it was a little sketchy, but that thought changed when entering the bar. I wouldn't consider it a dive bar, but more of a small bar with lots of character. The staff were the best part about this bar. They were friendly, funny, and straight shooters. Almost like instantaneous friends.

The big claim to fame here is apparently the bottomless mimosas and food - and man was it good! I had the strawberry waffles for breakfast, which had prosciutto cooked in, by the way! It was AMAZING! It was probably one of the best breakfasts I've ever had with the sweet and salty, amazing may not even fully describe it. 

Part way through the meal, the one lady working there as what seemed to be jack of all trades, said it was her friends birthday (who was sitting at a table) and were were all going to do a waterfall. One person started chugging their mimosa and we went around the room until everyone had finished. It was a lot of fun and something not possible at a chain or larger bar or restaurant. It was something I would do with friends.

I'd highly recommend this place for the drinks, the food, and especially the awesome staff that works there. I can't wait to go back and try some more of their food!
author: Stephen B.

description:
This was a cute cozy little spot with comfortable bench seating, and a huge patio in the back that can cater to large groups.  While we didn't play any board games, I noticed that they have a large selection of them for customers to play while you're there.  My entire party ordered the Bottomless Mimosas, but since I don't drink I can only review the food.  Here's what I had:

Veggie Omelet: Spinach, Tomato, Mushroom & Goat Cheese - $11

It was a decent omelette but nothing too special.  I still prefer Bill's Cafe and the Evergreen Pub Inn here in SJ over this place.  What does make this place special is the atmosphere, the art on the walls which also happen to be for sale, and the overall concept.  (I don't know any other breakfast spots that have board games on hand for people to play.)
author: Lorie N.

description:
Don't bother, especially for food.  I wanted to like this place but it just SUCKED.
The gal tending bar had zero help and a long line waiting to order. Everything is ordered through that one person - drinks and food. She was doing a great job but no one else working there was giving her any help. The outdoors patio was somewhat appealing - except that half of the folks out there were smoking up a storm.
The beer on-tap selection was marginal but the food was just terrible.  A salad arrived with no dressing and about half of the ingredients on the menu missing.  When this was brought to the kitchen's attention it was greeted with a shrug and "that's just what we have", we left the salad.  The sliders were OK but really small, even for a slider and priced like this was a high-end FIDI bar. We saw a waiter drop a dish and scoop some of it back onto the plate and that was when we decided we weren't THAT hungry. He then delivered it to another table.

Incredible. The place is FILTHY, tables are left without wiping and lots of food scraps on the incredibly dirty floor (back to the plate of food dropped).
I get that some folks like sketchy places like this and I am one of them, just not THIS freakin' sketchy. Never again.
author: Jay A.

description:
Small noisy and fun.  Great staff.  Free Wifi and board games to play. Just walk in an find a seat. Great Mimosas.

Big patio in the back with picnic tables that is dog friendly.  Mimosas were tasty and our glasses never went empty..  Good orange juice.  Carnitas Benedict was tasty though the poached egg was over cooked and could have used more hollandaise. The girls that work there are very friendly and fun.  

The one drawback is that it is basically treated like a bar so you have to fight for a place to sit:  hover over a table you want and jump in if someone leaves.  Come around 1:30 instead of noon and you should be okay
author: Jerry W.

description:
It's smaller than Zeitgeist, but the food's better while the alcohol selection is smaller. Definitely more of a townie/local spot, and I like that. Also, man, those fries! And the sliders! So good.

I came with a group that I'd consider large for Sycamore--6 people--but didn't have to wait long to get a table that fit us all. It wasn't on the patio, but such is life. 

Because of Sycamore's size, popularity, and single bartender, you can often end up with periods of extreme busy-ness at the bar, where you might 10 minutes for your drink. But trust me, if you get out of line for those 10 minutes, you'll be able to go up and order without a wait when you go back up. It's like a tide!
author: Allison S.

description: I'm pretty done with this place. Their selection of beers on tap gets worse every time, and the amount of hipsters crowding the joint was funny at first, but now it's just too much. How can it be a rotating tap system if everything on draught is an IPA, double IPA, or stout with 9% ABV. That's not very diverse. Also, we got there on Saturday night, and the place wasn't too packed by around 10:30, so we ordered some food. It took forever to make fries and sliders. When the food came out, there was literally one slider. We decided to try the pork belly "donuts" too. That wasn't bad, but it was shredded pork, deep fried, and covered in maple syrup. It tasted like a chewier version of the free lunches you used to get at elementary/middle school where you'd get a sausage disc and carb sticks to dip into fake syrup.
author: Danny C.

description:
I chose this place for bottomless mimosas because it is near the BART station so my friends and I could get as drunk as we wanted to. The deal is AYCD for $8 with a food purchase. We got seats inside so the waitress was able to constantly top off our glasses. 

FOOD: YES, the pork belly doughnuts are to die for. I was a little disappointed by the chicken and waffles. They tasted like they were frozen and re-heated to serve. The biscuit of the egg slider was as hard as a rock. The mimosas are made with OJ from the carton - not very fresh or variable in flavor. 

SERVICE: You order your food at the bar and find your own seating. This place has a very laidback vibe and the workers kind of let you relax and enjoy your meal at your own pace. 

Overall: This place is a very hip spot to grab a beer and enjoy some pork belly doughnuts. Food was mediocre.. I would go somewhere else for mimosas only because I think it is fun to try different flavors.
author: Amy V.

description: this place is pretty good.  Definitely an interesting aesthetic but hey I like variety in my life.  I am a vegetarian usually but I ordered the bacon wrapped jalapeño poppers because I am living life on the edge.  I ate them all, and fast.  Might have been the best poppers I've ever had.  Not because it was the one time per 6 months or so that I eat meat, but simply because they were well done.  Perfect amount of heat, perfect texture.  Didn't even need the aioli they serve it with.
author: A R.

description: good food.  Small but quality selection of beers.  quaint patio out back
author: Alan C.

description:
This place is pretty awesome on a Saturday afternoon, or on a Friday night. Small inside, but with outdoor seating.

For the afternoon we were able to try a bunch of dishes, having lots of wine, while playing Connect4 and Operation :)

What we feasted on:
-Pork Belly Donuts. they are ridiculous. 
-Kale dip and chips. Dip seemed like it needed to be heated up, but was really good still.
-Fried Mac & Cheese bites. These suckers were amazing. crisp on the outside, two bites, and al dente pasta sauced well in the center. came with a spicy side dipping sauce.
-4 sliders- Lamb, Fried Chicken, Catfish, Beef. all but beef were perfect. flavorful in every bite, the beef seemed overcooked. got side salad with this, and light dressing on it was refreshing
author: Abigail W.

description:
The Sycamore is a really fascinating place. At first, it seems like a bit of a dive bar in the middle of a bustling and somewhat dirty section of the mission. There's only very limited seating in front and a tiny bar serving a selection of craft brews. It doesn't really seem like a place where you would want to eat brunch. However, you'd be doing yourself a disservice if you skipped the breakfast fare.

Plus, you'll soon discover that the and of a long call down the right side of the back of the restaurant leads to a small patio in the back with some picnic tables were to great place to just chill, have a drink, and enjoy a little breakfast. We started off with the pork donuts, which is pretty much a piece of pork battered up and fried like a doughnut with a sugary syrupy glaze. It sounds insane, and it's pretty freaking delicious. I went for the biscuits and gravy, which for any place outside the South is pretty delicious. My wife and other friend who were there went for a selection of the brunch sliders. I tried several and all were delicious.

By the time we finished our brunch and had a couple of beers, we had to take off because we had an appointment to look at an apartment just down the street. Ultimately, we ended up taking that apartment, and perhaps it was not entirely a coincidence that we just had a delicious breakfast and a couple of beers on a sunny patio just down the street. I don't know, you be the judge.
author: Brent W.

description:
This place looks like a dive bar and there's surprisingly no line for brunch before noon. I got a veggie scramble, which was nothing too special. The pork belly doughnuts were good and interesting, but not something I'd order again. So, why am I giving this place 4 stars? 

Charlie! The man who refilled our bottomless mimosas glass after glass. I love that there was no time limit on our stay and even long after we had finished our food, my friend and I were chatting with our mimosas in one hand and glasses of water in the other.

The place looks tiny but there's a patio in the back thats great for groups and a lot more spacious. I'm definitely coming back, I want to try the huge variety of beers I saw on tap
author: Winnie T.

description: Seems like a pretty cool place, with a good jukebox. I was walking  by and chanced onto it. I was in the mood for a really good cheeseburger--for takeout--and thought I saw burger on the menu hanging outside the door. Once inside, I discovered it was a black bean burger, but the bartender (who was cool and friendly) suggested roast beef sandwich. It was absolutely delectable! Really fine quality roast beef, and a good quantity, hot melty cheddar, a horesradish sauce, nice bun.  Delish. The french fries were adequate--but way way overly salted and seemed like they were breaded or twice fried or something, which is not my thing. But that sandwich...I'd like to come back with friends for drinks, hang, and food.
author: Swiss C.

description:
What a fun brunch with great food - and the bottomless mimosas are not to be ignored, either. In fact, the mimosa server was the most popular person in the whole joint, never letting anyone's glass run dry, and the orange juice they used was fantastic - perfectly pulpy, with a great ratio of juice to sparkle.

We had a variety of food: each of the sliders, pork belly donuts, chicken and waffles and more. I focused on the chicken and waffles and the pork belly donuts. Chicken and waffles are not usually my thing, but these were so delicious. The chicken was a bit overcooked, but the waffles made the dish - stuffed with manchego cheese and prosciutto with a Maker's Mark and maple syrup, topped with kiwi - so good. It was hard to move on the pork belly donuts.

Once I tried the donuts, though, all bets were off. They were the perfect balance of salt, savory and sweet with more of the Maker's Mark glaze to top it all off. I could have eaten at least another order if not more (but I didn't want to have to buy new, bigger, pants to go back home) ;)

It was interesting to watch people get frustrated with the order system. It says clear as day at the top of the menu that you order from the bartender, then someone brings out your food. However, quite a few people left in a huff assuming the service was poor without even bothering to look at the menu to see the instructions. 

With a patio and indoor seating, bottomless mimosas and inventive food, this place fills up quick. Prepare to wait, but definitely go, and definitely grab a board game off the shelf to play with your friends or people sitting near by!
author: Leslie P.

description:
Great beer selection. Really decent food. Cool, nice respectful staff. Kick ass hidden patio. No frills. 

Five stars because it's a real dive bar done right. Keep in mind, it's a bit of a sh_thole and you can definitely catch a scent of some human street urine on the nose.
author: Marcus C.

description:
Wow, these pork belly 'donuts' really are worth the trip. They are basically cubes of port belly (thick layer of fat and all - since 'fat is flava') with a light puffy batter that is then deep fried. Boy, the ultra rich donut batter surrounding the even richer pork belly could be almost too much if it wasn't for their genius boozy sauce that cuts through all the richness to save your taste buds from cardiac arrest. 

Tip: Line out the door? you can go up to the bar and get an order of the 'donuts' to-go and enjoy these finger foods while you wait for your brunch table or just enjoy them 'para llevar'.
author: John H.

description: Delicious bar food. We LOVE the French fries. They're basic and amazing. Lots of games to play and beers to drink.
author: A P.

description:
4 stars because the service is great and those pork belly donuts are amazing. 

-1 because it's super small. Came here on a Saturday for brunch and didn't realize how small the place was. Ordered food and didn't notice that we had no place sit. Asked for it to-go, ended up getting a table. So we ate here....7 people squeezed in a 4 person table. 

The mimosa lady came by very (maybe too) often to fill our bottomless mimosas glass. Those pork donuts are THE BEST. Food was alright (sliders were reeeeaallyyy small....even though they're sliders (2 bite max for sliders). 

WARNING: extremely hipster. Beware.
author: Kimmy D.

description: Thank you for taking my order, never putting my order in, then serving everyone around me; and then never telling me my food wasn't coming.  And when we asked you, you never attempted to make the situation right.  Your dirty, dingy place is a reflection of your service... And probably your food (although I would know because you forgot my order).  You suck!
author: Daniel C.

description:
Very curt service. Somewhat rude and sharp. 

The ambiance is grungy. Tables were sticky and wobbly.

Some people like these kinds of things. I have to be in the mood.

I'd give the food a B+.
author: Ian S.

description: Had a credit card mix up, but Chandra and a couple of regulars helped the situation out. PS The food and beer is really good.
author: Greg K.

description:
This is a great gastropub in the Mission. It's pretty small, so it's best to come during off hours. The pork belly donuts are a must and they have a great selection of beers on draft.

The indoor area is pretty small, but they have a patio out back with several tables.
author: Kenny J.

description:
I'm thinking this place is more of a hot spot for locals. Very divey bar, rickety furnishings, dim lighting. My buddy and I were grabbing a late dinner so we placed our order at the bar and grabbed a table. Drinks were reasonably priced, they had a pretty good draught selection ranging from $5-7. There were also a good number of wines and sangria.

We were pretty hungry so we ordered a bunch of sliders with fries. If we had to place them in order from best to worst, it would look something like this:
1. Chicken
2. BLT
3. Lamb
4. Catfish
5. Ground Beef

Didn't really enjoy the last two, would probably pass on those. The sliders were pretty small and expensive for what you got at $3.50 each. We also got the pork belly donuts for the novelty. Meh, if you like all that fried food at county fairs, you might enjoy this, but I wasn't a fan.

Overall, service was very friendly, bartender was great. Drinks were typical bar prices if not cheaper. Food was subpar. I'd probably just come for the drinks.
author: Daniel K.

description:
Oh man, the food here is phenomenal. The Sycamore has some quality fried and savory goodness that will surely complement one of the many beers on tap that they offer here. I'd say the food is enough to make me come back! Aside from the food, the staff here is great and the place has a more divey/gastropub-isque feel to it with its crowd, beer and wine selection, and food selection, in addition to the presence of dogs. What's great is that there's also an outdoor patio (that I have yet to check out for myself).

The sliders here are delicious, especially the fried chicken slider and the lamb burger slider. Each slider is packed with flavor and each comes with a reasonable portion of meat in addition to various condiments including different types of aioli sauces and cheese. The beef and lamb patties are cooked medium so the meat literally melts in your mouth. Additionally, you've got to try the pork belly doughnuts here! They are literally what they sound like - slices of savory pork belly battered up and deep fried and then covered with a sweet maple and bourbon glaze that complements the savory meat incredibly. The doughnuts and the sliders are a must!

Anyone with the drunchies here will not be disappointed. Perhaps this place will eventually lead me to giving it five stars once I've checked out the patio, brunch and lunch specials, in addition to board games available to customers. All in all, a great place with great food. I'll be back.
author: Cheston W.

description: Stopped in for a drink and was pleasantly surprised to find Goose Island Bourbon County Stout on tap (a Chicago beer that is nearly impossible to find in Chi town).  It was happy hour, so all drafts were $1 off.  Great indoor seating with the windows open and they also have a patio in back.  I will definitely be going back to try the food, and bottomless mimosa brunch.
author: Nick G.

description:
I was speed-walking past this place when my friend alerted me to its presence, "Hey isn't this one of the places you've bookmarked?" I immediately screeched to a halt and entered Sycamore. The place is pretty dark, shielded by curtains, and painted black, so it was kind of hard to tell it was open. 

It was actually bustling inside. Yippee for $10 bottomless mimosas! This had a definite dive-y vibe and they provide you with board games that you might play while slowly sipping your money's worth of mimosas. 

For more substantial food, I ordered their banana bread pudding french toast with banana oatmeal. They did a good job of frying something so moist as banana bread pudding into something so crispy on the outside. I usually hate oatmeal but this oatmeal was infused with banana. And the syrup! The menu says Maple Makers Mark syup, so I assume it's some bourbon maple syrup.  Whatever it was, it went sooo well with the dish. 

I tried one of their lamb sliders with home fries. The meat was tender and juicy; the fries were okay, could've been cooked more.
author: Alice L.

description: The Sycamore is one of my favorite bars in the Mission. They always have great beers on tap, and their Beer Week events are always the best. They have a pretty good jukebox and GREAT food. Their roast beef sandwich and fried chicken sliders are fantastic. It's typically pretty crowded, so the line for beer and the wait for food can get kinda long. However, their outside porch area in the back is totally worth it AND they have a bunch of board games that you can play. I love coming here with a small group of friends and hanging out all evening.
author: Regina L.

description:
This was one of the coolest places I've ever been, and definitely the coolest for brunch! The chicken and waffles was a tasty combo, but the best was the bottomless mimosas. Best place to go is out on the patio with a fun group, and play some party games like Cards Against Humanity and such. 

A great restaurant with cool vibes, with bottomless mimosas, what's not to love?
author: Spencer G.

description:
I have been to Sycamore both at night, and for their weekend brunch. I would give the bar 4.5 stars, and the brunch 3. 

The ladies who run the place are incredibly nice and friendly, and out of all the places I have been to in SF (bars and restaurants), Sycamore has consistently had the best music, in my opinion. There is both an indoor section and an outdoor patio, as well as a great selection of board games.

Sycamore: The Bar - The beer selection is not huge, but is very well-selected. I appreciated that they (on occasion) have had some of my favorite out-of-town craft beers (such as Allagash, from Maine). Friends from other cities have also commented that they see a few of their favorite hometown brews available, from time to time. I have not tried the mixed drinks here. I wish it stayed open a little later, but overall Sycamore is one of my favorite bars in the Mission.

Sycamore: The Brunch - I ordered the veggie scramble and a mimosa when I came here for brunch, and both were a little disappointing. The scramble had kale and goat cheese in it, and not very many other vegetables. The eggs tasted a bit rubbery. The mimosa tasted pretty OK - it was made with cartons of Odwalla OJ, so not ideal if you're expected freshly squeezed juice with your mimosa. I wouldn't mind coming back and trying something different, as I hear that sliders and the pork belly donuts are exceptional.
author: Manu V.

description:
The service here is really great. They were very friendly and greeted me like a friend. 

I love mimosas, so when I saw their healthy pitchers waiting for my consumption, I got one right away. However, mimosas are not orange juice with a drop of champagne. Mimosuck.

I got an eggs benedict type thing with salmon. Pretty good. Nothing cray.

Also, the bathrooms are pretty shabby, but, that's SF.

Really nice patio area to chill out at night.
author: Sam D.

description: The three stars all go to the pork belly donuts. Everything else was mediocre, including the service.
author: Gloria Z.

description:
MIMOSA'S!  Unlimited!

Good food, tight fit, not easy to get to for a visitor so ask a local how to get here.  I think it is worth the adventure!
author: Dean P.

description:
Rocker, hipster or 9-5 office worker, the friendly folks at The Sycamore will welcome you with plenty of genuine smiles. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wNcShx5YTSMvOxt6G0iA9w?select=8BgoXq2X7S1FPqPOMLMJJw

Sycamore is a Groupon find.  If not for Groupon I probably would not have discovered this neighborhood bar for our monthly foodie lunch with my foodie friend, Heather. 

Sycamore is tiny, funky and the vive is friendly. The decor is eclectically rocker-fun with dark  blood red walls and black/white paintings. The bar is stocked with beers. (I tried to order tea but they said they only serve soda and beer only.) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wNcShx5YTSMvOxt6G0iA9w?select=5WbSOH7pM5I1FSMB0TBEEg http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wNcShx5YTSMvOxt6G0iA9w?select=zLVszlyZuu4PFN_f6v46xg

What sold us was the promise of PORK BELLY DONUTS W/ MAPLE MAKERS MARK GLAZE. (3 for $3): Heather and I were so intrigued while we were planning our lunch date and really looked forward to trying this appetizer. And I almost broke my seafoodtarian diet to try one of these donuts. Luckily, I did not have to.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wNcShx5YTSMvOxt6G0iA9w?select=kgc1aWAOWUkc7uaHVTknNg

Before I popped a whole one in my mouth, Heather cut one donut in half and we found a big chunk of pork in the middle. I just ate the fried dough and I still got the flavor of the pork without eating the meat. I could not really taste the Makers Mark glaze. The dough was nice but we did not do this food justice. We are not pork gals so just tasted one each and left the pork out.  Good concept, though! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wNcShx5YTSMvOxt6G0iA9w?select=NsJDKxQ2lcDC0YtXrnD-bQ

SALAD: Butter Lettuce with Pear, Strawberries, Goat Cheese, Chives and Creamy Tarragon Vinaigrette  ($8) This salad was so ginormous! Sad to say, it was not a very good salad. The butter lettuce was not cut and we had to cut them which was hard because we only had appetizer plates. The quantity was great for sharing but the ingredients did not come together nor the dressing well-balanced.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wNcShx5YTSMvOxt6G0iA9w?select=pZ0GxbVVfyJbKeUr82i7Ag

BEER BATTERED ROCK COD SLIDERS with Sriracha Aioli and House Made Pickles ($3): These are the bomb!!!! Hot, fresh off the fryer, delish and flavorful! A "must order "when at Sycamore. You can mix and match their sliders of lamb or beef burger, and/or fried chicken sliders for $3 each.  http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wNcShx5YTSMvOxt6G0iA9w?select=Dcw-JDqBy_ygLQ69UzS5UA

SEITAN SANDWICH ($8): Let me put it this way. Unless you are a vegetarian, I will go for the beer battered rock cod sliders.  This sammy was huge but tasteless and dry.  And seitan is one of my favorite non-meat products. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/wNcShx5YTSMvOxt6G0iA9w?select=K9RKOmtJiYxhGKDK2pfNTA

FRIES: $1 more with the order of sliders. Not very good. Greasy and overly fried.

OVERALL:
Sycamore is a cool place with decent food and great value. They will definiltely feed you without stealing your wallet. If I were a beer drinker I will come this place but I would not mind returning for those sliders.

The interior is fun but on the divey/gritty side. It did not help that it was storming when we got there. We were wet and cold, and the place was not heated. (I overheard that they were fixing their heater.)

TAB: With the $25 Groupon, Heather only paid $5 more. Thanks, Heather for a fun birthday lunch, 7x7 mags and Cupcake champagne! XXOOXX
author: Leah E.

description: Absolutely a smart choice to a boozy breakfast. The endless mimosas keep a smile on everyone's face. The chicken sliders with crazy reminds me of an easier time growing up with Grandma. This food was fresh, hot, delicious, and quick!!
author: James C.

description:
I've gone to the Sycamore for brunch a few times now, and I'm impressed with how quickly they refill your bottomless mimosa glass. The servers are efficient and friendly, and the atmosphere is cozy, sunny, youthful. 

I've had their pork belly donuts, chicken+waffles, biscuits+gravy, as well as one of their omelette plates, and everything was decent. The portions are a bit on the small side and I would recommend getting their more unusual dishes to make the price worth it. 

The chicken+waffles in particular are stuffed with prosciutto and sauced with a maker's mark maple syrup. The pork belly donuts taste almost the same as the chicken+waffles, only with the added delicious fattiness of the pork. The omelettes (side of home fries, side of fruit) are tasty but pretty standard as far as omelettes go. Same goes for their biscuits, gravy, and fries.

Overall a great place to lounge around on the weekend, where the atmosphere makes up for the good-but-not-stellar food.
author: Jasper P.

description:
Stop 3 on Dream Team's Beer Week Tour de Beer. I had never been here before. But I had read a lot about it. And since this was stop 3 I was very eager to get there and very tired. 

"WE'RE HERE."
"This is it....? It's a shoebox!"
"Yep. THIS IS IT."
".... you have to be kidding me... why are all the beers 8 bucks!!!!???"

We ended up both getting a beer that tasted like Trader Joe's Pffernusse christmas cookies- the spice profile on that beer was over the top and made it difficult to drink. 

But they have a patio (also the size of a shoebox) however I get the feeling my visit was highly a-typical of a night at the Sycamore and I will be back.
author: Emily D.

description:
Pork belly donuts, AMAZING. It's a nice combination of sweet, salty and fatty. Super unique.

Sliders - meh. Definitely had better. Had the breakfast slider with sausage, and it seemed a little off.

Lamb slider was good, but no nom nom nom moment.

The benedicts looked good, should have tried that.

Cool that you can play board games while hanging out. I approve.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
This space is very enjoyable. 
Beers and wine only.
Staff: friendly, fun and relaxed
Atmosphere: chill, outdoor space, movies outside sometimes 
Overall: nice, comfortable, awesome-grungy, check it out!
author: Tom T.

description:
Eight dollars for a tiny beer, mediocre service, and nowhere to sit except the smoky-ass patio? Meh, no thanks.

To be totally fair, I went on a Friday evening, so maybe The Sycamore is a good place to go during the week, but I definitely don't think it's worth braving a weekend crowd.
author: Katie M.

description: A few buddies and I stopped by here for happy hour before a Giants game. It's a small dingy little bar that livens up when the jukebox is played though. We ordered a round of craft beers (on tap of course) along with various sliders and appetizers, but the star of the show was the Pork Belly Donuts with Maker's Mark Glaze. It's an interesting item of battered and fried pork belly drenched in a sauce made of bourbon. Crunchy and savory with pork belly underneath it all. Cheers!
author: Joe N.

description: I highly recommend quiz night on Mondays at 7:30pm. There are 6 rounds covering everything from current events to famous literature. Quizmaster Keith is the best. He does a great job asking the questions and keeping the crowd entertained. I will definitely be coming back again.
author: Brian L.

description:
$12 bottomless mimosas, and the waitresses are 100% on top of refilling constantly. 

The food is delicious too, although slightly on the smaller portion side. (Truthfully it's probably a healthier portion, but just small for me and compared to the brunch standard.) 

Lastly, they've got a back patio and games like Cards Against Humanity! So good food, good booze, good games, good friends!
author: Rowena L.

description: This place didn't throw me a curve, only sliders, and they rocked! I'll be back for sure!
author: Carlos S.

description:
It was a really warm day so we tried to get outdoor seating, which was a little challenging. The one vacant spot was in the sun because their umbrella was broken (go figure, that's probably why it was open). It was noon so the sun made it really hot, but it was fine.

You definitely have to try the pork belly donuts, but you can share (3 come in an order and you probably only need 1!). The salmon benedict was amazing, as were the bottomless mimosas - a server comes around to refill glasses so just try to keep track of how many you are drinking.
author: Courtney N.

description:
$10 bottomless mimosas?  Yes Please!  And when they say bottomless, they mean it!  I dare you to get to the bottom of your glass before the mimosa fairy comes by.  I should learn her name b/c she's awesome, but regardless, Sycamore is a sweet spot.  Good food at a reasonable price, and awesome service and a nice chill spot.  Since it's on Mission instead of Valencia it's a bit more low key, which is nice.  I've only been on off hours mostly but there's always a nice group of folks there.

I used to miss Country Station Sushi which was here and have tried the various incarnations it's been since but I'm really pleased with Sycamore and will def be going back a lot since it's in my hood!
author: Gene X.

description:
Came here for lunch with fellow yelper Eric L. and I think it's safe to say that we were both pretty satisfied with The Sycamore.

We opted for the following:

-At $3.50 for each slider, we simply just went for 1 of everything.  The beer battered rock cod slider and the lamb slider were my favorites!!  We also got the fried chicken as well as the regular ground beef options and they were ok too.

-Pulled pork sandwich - decent, but nothing spectacular for me.

-Sides of fries......sooo tasty!  Loooove.

-Lastly, we ordered pork belly donuts.....again.....PORK. BELLY. DONUTS.  need I say more?  OMG so gooooood!

Sycamore is a small little gastropub in the Mission and definitely quite the cozy spot.  I loved the ambiance and I'd definitely love to come back again one day and check out the rest of their menu along with their selective range of beers.
author: Carmen Y.

description: A friend brought us here for brunch and it was phenomenal. The staff was super friendly and helped us snag a table. A friend of the staff was celebrating a birthday so we did a mimosa waterfall around the room -- everyone participated which added to the fun. At brunch, bottomless mimosas are $12 if you buy $8 of food which is easy with the food prices. The food is mostly in small portions but worth every penny. The chicken & waffles and pork belly donuts (with Makers Mark syrup) were both incredible and the sliders were tasty as well, though biscuits were on the dry side. Would highly recommend and would come back the next time I'm in town!
author: Shannon P.

description:
My friend and I dropped by for a quick dinner, went in sight unseen, and we were pleasantly surprised! We HAD TO have the fried mac n cheese balls which did not disappoint! In addition to comfortable pub food they had some salads too! I really liked my cobb salad. The wine selection is decent too. The food also came out in a timely manner.

One teensy tiny queja: the bartender gave us too much hipster attitude. Ornery would describe her level of service. But fortunately you don't have to deal with that once you order and pay. They leave you alone and let you enjoy the food and company.
author: Andrea A.

description:
The breakfast here is so amazing that I'm tempted to not review it so I don't have to compete with more people... but alas fairness prevails. 

The waffle may be the best thing I've ever eaten. The bottomless mimosas are dangerous -- watch out -- the wait staff are like ninjas when they are the prowl to refill your glass. 

The patio outside is very nice as well, but it takes some luck and/or patience to nab a nice spot.
author: Angela M.

description:
This was hub's pick.  He was lured by the pork belly donuts so we went to The Sycamore for lunch.  When we walked in, it was completely empty which I was not expecting.  It didn't even look like somewhere where food is served- it looked like a dingy, dusty bar. 

We sat down inside and ordered the pork belly donuts, 1 each of the sliders (regular, lamb, chicken, cod, fried egg) and bottomless mimosas.  To be honest, I couldn't stop thinking about how the place didn't look clean the whole time.  It wasn't filthy but just a place that looked like tons of people got drunk and sloppy there the night before.  We started playing board games while we waited for our food which was fun.  They have a variety of classic games to choose from.

Pork belly donuts: it tastes like exactly what it is.  No pleasant surprises.  Just pork belly fried in batter, topped with syrup.  Although it was good, I wouldn't go back to eat it again.  I think it would have been better if the pork belly was browned before it was dipped in the batter.  Also, the outside batter needed to be crunchier.  The ones we ate were a bit soggy, limp and pale (and not from the syrup).

Sliders were all pretty tasty, particularly the lamb slider.  Everything else was good but not great.  I just took a bite of each and called it a day.  

This place is more of a bar that you should come to at night time to mainly grab drinks and have some drunken snacks.
author: Lanna K.

description:
A sunny Sunday in the city calls for a (bottomless) mimosa brunch with friends! We decided upon Sycamore in the Mission district. 

(+):
-A block away from the 16th street bart station.
-Simple brunch menu so you won't suffer from indecisiveness like me and focus on drinking (note: $12 bottomless mimosas if you order $8 worth of food or more). Ordered the roast beef sandwich which was full of meaty goodness, bbq sauce, and mayo. Side salad to balance it out. Next time I'll order the sliders cause they looked pretty bomb.
-Servers are friendly. The lady who came around with the mimosa pitcher was like a ninja! Every time one of us set our glasses down it would be magically full a second later.
-Dog friendly! Bring them to hang out with you in the back patio. The lady even offered fresh water for one of our pups.
-Chill and friendly vibe from everyone. No one was an obnoxious drunk mess thank goodness.
-They take card. Nice enough to split the check too.

(-):
-Food takes forever to come out. Waited a good 30 minutes just for a roast beef burger & salad
-Open seating = hovering over tables to snag spots. Tough if you're a big group like us (8 or so) and want to sit together. Solved this by using the stools to sit on in the patio.
-Place is rather small so you're bumping into people here and there walking to/from the bar or around the patio
-Flies around the patio. They probably can't do much about those, but I couldn't help but notice and hoped none of them would land in my food/drink.

Overall: Good place to come to if you intend on doing more drinking than eating. Bar type of food but they do live up to bottomless mimosa drinking. Place is small, so get there right when it opens to snag some seats.
author: Loriel L.

description:
Not too crowded and I like the back patio area a lot. It was drizzly the second time I went, so no patio action, but it's definitely a cozy place to have a beer or two.

The pork belly donuts are what they're known for, so we had to get an order. Intriguing in concept, but the execution fell a little flat. A $4 order comes with three samosa-esque pacakages of fried dough with the teased tips of dough that come from the hand dredging of the pork belly. Super rich big chunk of pork belly in the middle was a little jarring, and it was a less a donut and more a pork belly fest with a little dough for contrast. A bit more of the sugary syrup stuff would have helped maybe.

Good beer selection and I love that they have board games up on the side.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Dog friendly on the back patio! It was pretty busy when we got there on a Sunday noon-ish but after waiting for a bit, a group was kind enough to give us their table (bottomless mimosas make everyone friendlier). It got pretty hot back there so if you can sit under an umbrella, go for it.

We tried all of the sliders and the donuts. The donuts were good and the lamb burgers were my favorite. The chicken and biscuits were ok, not my favorite. I think there was another egg breakfasty one that was ok too. 

The atmosphere was really nice, the waiters/waitresses were all super friendly and generous with the mimosas. They even brought a water dish for my dog. Not great if you're in a rush, since getting a table and then the food does take some time, but if you don't mind hanging out, definitely a place to check out.
author: Christine H.

description:
I love this bar! Awesome place to spend a rainy lazy Sunday. Place was packed and we opt for the patio seats which was covered by a big tent to avoid getting wet from the rain. The crowd here is super friendly and chatty. Definitely a place for people watching. The staff was entertaining and made us feel welcomed. Beer on tap and plenty of IPA choices if you're into that. The garlic fries were yummy and I would come back to try the other foods. The only downside were how worn out the games were. Some of the pieces were greasy and missing. The boxes were taped together and falling apart but it doesn't matter after a few drinks right?

Definitely will be back!
author: Kelly C.

description:
Two words: BOARD GAMES. I don't drink. I hate bars far more often than I like them, but I love Sycamore.  They have board games. Trivia night is really fun. Great music on the jukebox. And those pork belly donuts? I'd happily have a heart attack at 30 if it meant board games, trivia, Wire and those donuts until the big enfarto. That would be a life well-spent. 

Such a great place. The nice staff is just the icing on the cake.
author: Shana H.

description: This is my favorite bar/pub/hangout spot EVER. My go-to place for any occasion. The food is great - the pork belly donuts are on some last meal-level sh*t - one of the best things to eat on the planet earth. I could write a whole treatise on how damn good they are. The beer selection is perfect - not overwhelming but substantial. There's always something I want to drink. The team is great, too. And the patio seals the deal for me - a great hangout whether with a crew or rolling solo. I can't say enough good stuff about this place. It's where I go to celebrate birthdays, minor successes, or just being alive. GO!
author: Jay L.

description:
Brunch review only...

Loved the laid back feel to the place with the cozy banquette seating, rickety tables, and numerous board games piled up on the shelf. Plenty of beers on tap, pork belly donuts on the menu: all positive points to me.

It might have been due to the unseasonably warm day, but the large number of flies buzzing about the place (indoors and also around the enclosed patio) was a little off putting.

Mixed review on my carnitas benedict.  Loved the flavor of the masa base with the poached eggs on top and the Mexican inspired Hollandaise.  This would've been a truly delicious meal if 1) eggs weren't undercooked, with runny whites and 2)  potatoes weren't burnt.  

Didn't try it, but the pulled pork sandwich was quite enjoyed.

I can see The Sycamore might be a really fun spot as a bar....but I'm not yet wholly convinced on the gastro part of this gastropub. 

I might need to make a repeat visit to try their famed pork belly donuts and/or sliders.
author: Joanne G.

description:
First off, hats off to the genius who signed up for the $25 Groupon sold at only $10, much love to you Sycamore manager!  (I was so excited I bought 2 and I'm glad I did)

We went there today  (there was a glitch there today, apparently the "slider" rolls did not get delivered in time for lunch, so we were told we need to order whole sandwiches at $8.)  No biggie really since I was planning on ordering 2 chicken sliders anyway.
what we ordered:
*1 roast beef sammy W/fries
*1 chicken sammy - It was a tough call, but this was slightly better than the roast beef
*1 order pork belly doughnuts - delish
*1 draft beer
Total cost - including tip, NOT including Groupon purchase: $6

Experience: priceless.  

Next time I am ordering the fried provolone cheese,  mmmmmm cheese.

UPDATE:  I went back for my 2nd Groupon and had the fried provolone cheese--YOWZA!  mmm-mmmm.  (homer simpson voice)
author: Amy W.

description:
The best $20 I spent in a very long time!

A met up with a friend here after work last night- so happy we did too!

We tried the pork belly donuts, creative sliders, fries - with aioli, salad... oh and beer (insert silent female burp here)

Lamb burger sliders  - well seasoned ground lamb, caramelized onions, romesco aioli and manchego cheese - dangerously divine bites! I'm craving the flavor again as I type this.

Cozy place with character.  Local art decorates the walls.  It was pretty packed for a Tuesday night but not loud which is a plus when you're catching up with a friend.  Also noteworthy: a cool bartender who's a working owner, nice guy, super helpful when I was choosing my beer and asking him annoying customer questions :)  

I'd return here soon, but please, no paparazzi or stalkers please.
author: Athena S.

description:
How great is this place!?  Our great friend Kelle brought us here as our first stop back to the great city of San Francisco.  She could not have picked a better joint.

Super cool bar staff, and even complimentary Birthday shots due to it being Jeff's day.  What were they?  I have no idea.  These little bottles on the wall behind the bar.  Anise, I think?  Yes, they were good.

Nice outdoor space with plenty of seating.  That's always a plus in my book.

We actually came back (a few days later) for brunch & bottomless mimosas.  Pork belly is a winner.  Food was awesome.

I thought it was so cool how when they ran out of one beer -- it was gone.  And a new one took its place.  More bars should do this -- it forces you to venture out of your "beer comfort zone."

We'll be back.
author: Tony W.

description: This is such a cute hole-in-the-wall little place, with a pretty sweet patio you'd never know was there!  The Pork Belly Donuts were seriously good.  I mean SERIOUSLY GOOD!  They also have a delicious variety of sliders, which from what I tried were really good too.  My friend and I came here for brunch one Sunday afternoon.  The patio was a little too crowded for us so we sat inside, which was totally fine.  The service was great, even though it was the bartender serving us, she did a fantastic job!  The food was really yummy.  We didn't do the bottomless mimosas, but they did look delicious, and i'll probably be back again for them!  I also wouldn't mind coming back here some night, they have a ton of board games to play, and the bar just looks super cozy.  I like this place!
author: Allison R.

description: Went here for a Saturday boozy brunch, THEY REALLY TOP YOU OFF!! hahah but the food I got was not good. IT was a veggie type of eggs benedict and it sounded delish but the cheese on it was weird, like sour tasting. Def not my fave but the outdoor patio on a warm day is amazing! Def would recommend this place but just dont order what i did!
author: Brittini S.

description:
I really enjoyed this place! 
We sat outside and played Apples and Apples with a couple pints. The fried provolone, lamb sliders, and fries were all really yummy but loved the beef slider the best! I could go for about 3 of them right now, not to mention 3 pints as well.
The jukebox had a lot of great stuff on it and the only main problem was no working heaters outside!
author: Michele B.

description:
This is a huge improvement over the place that was here before. http://www.yelp.com/biz/cafe-prague-san-francisco-4#hrid:q6du4vvKRav9yFd1VGKg8w/src:self

They have a decent beer selection, a nice patio, and I hear the food isn't bad. This is a great alternative to  Zeitgeist for people that like outdoor drinking.
author: Manny F.

description:
I freaking LOVE this place.  I don't think I can rave enough about how consistently awesome my experiences are.

Awesome staff, super chill and always down to chat and provide great service.

Their beer selection is stellar and always reasonably priced.  Not to mention occasionally they will make a badass cocktail - like white sangria (which was super delicious) or some other delicious concoction. 

They also have a great outdoor patio area - and one section is a nice nook in which they have heat lamps - score!

Did I mention they also play amazing old school classic movies?  Enter The Dragon, Blue Velvet, Pretty in Pink - I mean come on. Amazing!!!!

And how could I forget the board games? And the great cheap food?! The pork sliders are a must.

In conclusion, you need to go and you can high five me when you get there.
author: Lauren B.

description: Yall are haters. Food is fine beers are great. One of my fav places to get some different good beer in the city. If you're looking for good amazing food....don't go to a dive bar. There's delfinas, bar tartine and plenty of restaurants. If you want food to go with your beers then go to a dive bar especially sycamores sliders. Have some love n don't except good service when it comes to bottomless ANYTHING in a bar :)
author: Laura R.

description:
When busy the wait for food can be awhile. 

Pork belly donuts: Interesting. I suspect that if you like breakfast food such as pancakes coated in maple syrup with bacon then you will like this donut very much. 

Sliders: the lamb and ground beef were good. You could definitely taste the blue cheese on the ground beef slider. We had two other sliders that were breakfast themed and those were not as good. The biscuit slider with grits(?) was soggy and the fried egg slider just wasn't as good as the other two. 

Outdoor patio allows dogs but can get very hot because there isn't much cover in some areas. They provided sunscreen though. 

I'm not much of a drinker so my recommendation on that sucks. There are bottomless mimosas though and they came around often to fill those.
author: Gee H.

description:
Not good for groups!!

This place is super small! 

Really why is it rated as good for groups?? 

We were 8 people and our group could barely fit into this place. So, I didn't actually eat or drink here (as I was in a group and we had to leave so we could actually be seated somewhere) but I have to spread the word: SMALL VENUE! NOT GOOD FOR GROUPS!

It looks cool though, and I am pissed I didn't get to try the sliders :(
author: Kathy S.

description:
This is my new favorite bar in the Mission, and I haven't even tried the food (judging by the other reviews, that would be a well-advised next step). They have Racer 5 on tap, alcoholic ginger beer (!!!), board games, a back patio, and a super cozy divey vibe. In fact, a couple of days after I came here for the first time I recommended it again when out with a different group of friends. You could argue I'm unadventurous, or you could take my word for it that The Sycamore is worth a repeat. 

I'll try the food & update... I'm guessing that'll land them that coveted fifth star. Stay tuned!
author: Janna M.

description:
Hemingway quote: "Got tight on absinthe last night. Did knife tricks." 

Akerman quote: "Got tight on ale last night. Did ale tricks. Played Operation." 

Hemingway quote: "The Sun Also Rises." 

Akerman quote: "Yea Ernie it does rise but it also sets so we can sit on the back patio at Sycamore in the night." 

Hemingway quote: "I heart cats." 

Akerman quote: "I heart girls who love my dog." 

Hemingway quote: "I heart cats." 

Akerman quote: "I heart pork belly donuts." 

Hemingway quote: "There was An Old Man And The Sea." 

Akerman quote: "There was a young man with a sea of ale on his pants." 

Hemingway quote: "I won't have operation." 

Akerman quote: "I love playing Operation." 

Hemingway quote: "Cats to Cats." 

Akerman quote: "No, it's Apples to Apples." 

Hemingway quote: "Shotgun." 

Akerman quote: "Beer." 

Hemingway quote: "Got tight on absinthe last night. Did knife tricks." 

Akerman quote: "Got tight pants, wet beer pants. Did 'my phone's dead I need a charger' hit on chicks tricks."
author: Jon A.

description:
This is a cozy little bar tucked away on Mission+Sycamore. It's almost easy to miss when you're walking down Mission -- unlike most of the bars you find in the area, it's quieter, chiller, and smaller with a more Portland vibe to it. They've got a healthy selection of board games and an eclectic selection of music (courtesy of a jukebox). This is a nice place to go if you want to actually have a conversation with your party, instead of yelling at each other at a crowded and loud place like the Elbo Room.

That being said, the food here is very overrated. While the pork belly donuts that my friends raved about were pretty good, I couldn't shake off the sneaking suspicion that I was eating glorified Chinese food. They're not really donuts -- more like breaded and deep fried chunks of pork covered in some honey glaze (I know that the bar description reads Maker's Mark glaze, but it really tasted like honey and maple syrup). The sliders were okay but relied too much on their sauces to give the burgers flavor. And the fries were just bad. Normally I inhale pounds of fries without any problem, but here, I just ate a couple of fries and called it a night.

I was initially going to give this place a 4 (just because I loved the ambiance) but I noticed that it had described itself as a "gastropub" (ala Magnolia and the Alembic) in its Yelp profile. Well, I suppose if that's the case, the food here really just deserves three stars.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Board games, burr, and and outside patio.  Love it!

Although it's pretty hard to snag a seat outside on a nice day or night, it's not really that hard if you show up early.  They have a whole wall of board games that we entertained ourselves with on a Saturday evening (okay, maybe just Apples to Apples).  

They don't serve pitchers though, so just individual beers at the Sycamore.
author: Adele Z.

description:
Perfect place for Sunday Brunch! They have a lovely patio out back that gets a lot of sun. Kim, the Mimosa Ninja, is serious about refilling the bottomless mimosas ($12 and they don't kick you out after 2 hours or anything). The food is delicious and relatively inexpensive. The portions are smaller so if you are hungry, maybe get two things or a side order of something.  The Sycamore isn't fancy, it's laid back and casual. It is a friendly environment where you can make friends with the people sitting next to you. 

It would be nice if they had some music outside :)
author: Amy C.

description:
This place is awful on several levels.  First, the salad I ordered had 2 ingredients missing and was bad.  When I asked about the pears that were on the menu listed in the salad "Oh we don't have any pears."  There was also no dressing on the salad.....
The place is filthy....trash, pieces of food, and other items on the floor.  The cushions torn and dirty.  Lastly, we did not want to eat on the patio as there were people smoking tobacco there.
author: Marti A.

description: Holy cow the pork belly donuts are sooo good and the mix & match mini sliders are outta this world good served with fresh mix greens...the vibe and the crowd are super laidback, anymore laidback they'd be horizontal. The dishes are super yummy. The honey loves it here, throwing back a few local brews. Definitely come back again. Go!
author: Ambrose A.

description: Right from the beginning, no one greeted us. The bartender was sloppy drunk && chatting it up with some girl. I had to reach over someone's drink to get a menu. I waited for 5 mins to finally get acknowledged by the bartender. I asked for the fried mac n cheese bites and a pitcher of bottomless mimosas (they had a sign outside claiming there was bottomless mimosas as a happy hour special from 4pm-7pm. We got to this establishment at 4:45pm). The bartender had this dull look on his face and said, "I am sorry we don't have bottomless mimosas today. Bottomless mimosas are only for brunch and before 3pm." When I told him about the sign outside stating different, he sluggishly says, "Oh which sign? I don't even know which sign you're talking about." I told him, "The one you guys have right outside the door." And replies, "Oh yeah. I forgot to change the sign today." This place is a joke and they need a new bartender that isn't as dumb.
author: Marcela S.

description: I love mac n cheese so I really came for the mac and cheese balls, and I thought they were just okay. I ordered sliders, and I did enjoy those. I didn't personally love the atmosphere -- maybe we went a little too early in the evening for other people to really start coming in.
author: Dominique G.

description:
Im fast becoming a regular here...

I dont normally tend to go where all the hipster douche's go, but I cant refuse the food and especially Kim the mimosa goddess! 

They have a great back patio (that allows smoking) that I can be at any given saturday or sunday for the sliders and bottomless mimosas! "most" people I meet through the back patio are great to chat with, especially if they are nursing a hangover. The art on the patio and the walls fit very well with the atmosphere.

Ill be coming back till they kick me out!
author: Chazz d.

description:
This place was pretty small, but oh so friendly!!!!! There is a outdoor area in the back, but I didn't get a chance to check it out. 

Came here for brunch on a Sunday with a few friends. It was a very laid-back welcoming environment. They also had bottomless mimosas.

The service was great and they kept the drinks coming. I should mention, I was not drinking but the people I was with were and the staff never let their glasses become empty! 

I felt the food was okay. I tried the pork donut and it was good, a little oily inside. I also had the smoked salmon scramble, which I thought was okay.
author: Mary Anne P.

description:
You know what? I love this place. I'm almost afraid to write them an amazing review for fear the secret will get out.

The food is delicious. You can't compete with the pork belly donuts at brunch, or how your bottomless mimosa glass is truly bottomless. Seriously, you will not see the bottom of an empty glass, no matter how long you stick around on a Sunday morning. Carnitas Benedict's? Delicious. 

The beer is ever changing. Every time a keg is tapped, they change it up. This is a great place to go out on a limb and try a new brew.

There's the patio outside, the games, the bingo nights, the easy trivia... I could go on. But assume that if you're looking for a casual, comfortably vibe, the Sycamore has it.
author: Sarah B.

description: The pork belly donut is a must, the Brussels as well and the kale dip.. just order everything. .it's definitely not what I expect but I'm so glad I get to try the food.. wide range of beers.. definitely coming back
author: Anna T.

description:
I was here on a Friday night for a couple beers with a friend. Great tap list for such a small tiny bar! 

Here again a couple weeks later and we got the fried mac & cheese bites with pork belly and jalapeno. THEY WERE SO GOOD. My main meal was a grilled cheese with tomato soup and salad. Very satisfied. 

Good beer, extremely friendly bartenders (Kim is awesome!) and good food. Haven't been here for mimosa brunch yet but I heard it was great!
author: Emily H.

description:
There are four things you should know...

Pork belly donuts.
Bottomless mimosas.
Card games.
Outdoor patio.
author: Caitlin F.

description:
So great. Awesome sliders and always a great beer selection!

The games are always an added bonus!
author: chris m.

description: Three words: PORK. BELLY. DONUTS. Also, bottomless mimosas. Ok that's 6 words but it's basically the only 6 words you need to know. The patio is the perfect spot to enjoy these treats from heaven.
author: Brooke M.

description:
I hestiate to write this as I don't want people to show up when they can get crazy in other areas, this has a low key but fun demeanor... but

Throw me at the bar on a Sunday with The New York Times and I am in heaven.  Atmosphere, food and people are a blast. Attentive (to bottomless mimosas), food (a bit slow but solid) and the people... laughing and patient. You feel like you are more than a number or a seat.
author: C K.

description: Stopped here for a beer yesterday while my boyfriend and I were walking around in San Francisco, and I'm glad we decided to check this place out!  It's a tiny little corner bar, but once you step inside you can feel the character in this place!  We walked in and saw multiple groups of friends having a great time, drinking and playing games.  That was the coolest part about this place...they had an inventory of board games for the customers to play...very cool idea, I have not seen that at a bar before.  Fun atmosphere, polite and attentive service, good priced drinks, food looked great.  Will definitely go back!
author: Sara W.

description: Really chill spot with seating in the back patio. The food is pretty darn good and who can say no to bottomless mimosas with a great wait staff?!
author: Richard L.

description:
I wouldn't call the Sycamore a dive bar but I did go here to meet up with some friends who talk very highly of the Sycamore.

The place is kind of small but there is a patio area in the back.

It's really all beers and wines so no cocktails which was a little of a bummer but the beers were good.  They were pretty cheap drinks too.

Not too crowded and I heard the food is good.  I tried the pork belly donuts in the maker's syrup which was awesome.  We also got the spicy peanuts but they weren't that good.  I've heard pretty much all the food here is good, especially the sliders?

I'll have to come back again for more food.  I heard their brunch is pretty good too.
author: Kameron K.

description:
Stopped in here the other day for some drinks and to play some games. It was a good time! They had a huge selection of drinks and their food options looked awesome, too. I'll have to make sure to be hungry the next time I come (there WILL be a next time). 

Tip: You won't find Cards Against Humanity on the regular game shelf. They keep it behind the bar and you have to give them your ID to check it out.
author: Jeanine S.

description: My friend and I came here at noon on Saturday for brunch, and have been waiting 1 whole hour for our food. It still hasn't arrived, and whenever we ask about it, the waitstaff just brushes us off without responding! Dreadful service. Dreadful experience.
author: Seema G.

description:
This place is great as a bar, but gastropub - I think not.  Perhaps it's because I've eaten at so many real gastropubs in London, but I don't think this even qualifies for the term.

Sliders were ok, nothing special.  

As a bar however, this place rocks.  Intimate, friendly staff and mulled wine!  Extra bonus points for the lovely Irish bartender who obliged my homesickness a few days before Xmas by playing Fairytale of NY.

My current fav bar in the mission after Casanova.
author: Ali B.

description:
So you found out she doesn't love you. Big deal, spend all day drinking, amirite? 

But if you HAPPENED to walk in during craft beer week, whilst day drinking, maybe you'd indulge in some awesome beer. Maybe you'd even get a free glass. Maybe you'd even forget that you drove to the mission and you might need to take a taxi and leave your car in a seedy alleyway. 

Did I really get that drunk on only beer? 

Peak organic mocha stout. Drink it all.
author: Ben T.

description: Nice, cozy neighborhood bar. Small bar with good beers, more seating out back.
author: Ronan F.

description:
BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS, GUYS. 
they seriously never let your glass go more than half empty- and that's saying a LOT. Especially since when I went, there were large parties and the place was packed in the front AND the back. 

Also, if you're not vegetarian - you owe it to your fatty self to order the PORK BELLY DONUTS. such a good balance of sweet and salty~ !! 

will definitely come back again to enjoy bottomless mimosas & pork belly donuts~
author: Tiffany S.

description:
SF is where it's at for bottomless mimosa brunches!! The Sycamore is a nice little cafe/bar thang with tons of boardgames! bwahahhaha

My friend and I got a table right by the entrance, which was perfect to catch the breezes. So, you go up to the bar to order and they will bring your food to your table. There was a minimum order for the bottomless mimosas, so we indulged in:

- pork belly "donuts": they were literally little glazed donuts with pieces of pork belly inside. They were fresh out of the oven or wtver, and they were freaking delicious! A perfect combination of sweet and salty!
- breakfast chicken slider: fried chicken with country gravy on buttermilk biscuits. Are you drooling yet? Perfect with mimosas as the "brunch" part of the meal.
- lamb burger slider: this one was really strong and heavy. I really like lamb! Included caramelized onions, aioli, and cheese
- ground beef slider: so good! Had roasted garlic aioli, caramelized onions, blue cheese. I think I liked this one the best
- side of potatoes: made breakfast style. It tasted super good with the country gravy from the breakfast chicken slider! 

We must have had like at least 6 glasses each and played a couple board games. I'm never sure if mimosa brunches are a good idea cuz day drinking just results in really full tummies and mild headaches by the afternoon. Oh well! I had a great time here!
author: Erin H.

description:
Showed up with 6 at around 7PM on a Wednesday and there was no way we could sit together. Probably better for 1 - 3 people for the time I was there. Outside patio is pretty much the smoking area.

Will have to try it again with less folks
author: Daniel B.

description:
been here during a lunch time.

Likes: having a patio in this city.
        : friendly bar girl
        : routinely circulating, good selection of beers.
        : interesting menu items?
Dislikes: maple makers mark glaze pork belly donuts different but not a memorable       snack. sugar, grease and makers mark??   
         :Lunch special meat on meat sandwich was another average plate.
         : seems quite dirty spot. is this a number one rule to be a hipster mission spot? Little cleaning wouldn't hurt
author: Lyra S.

description:
How can you not like this place? I mean, it has an outdoor patio where you potentially will end up playing Apples To Apples with strangers who turn out to be friends with your coworker and have no idea what a toaster is (true story). 

While people tend to get a little rambunctious playing board games and swilling beer, it never gets rowdy or crowded in here, which I appreciate. The food seems to chill everyone out and it's overall coziness just makes for a great hangout. I've found this to be the case on Saturday nights especially. Excellent beer on tap and although everyone's saying it I'll chime in too: pork belly donuts! The vibe here makes it for me, not too sceney, not too loud, just a nice neighborhood bar.

And finally, and most importantly, it has a Dutch door. I mean, c'mon, that's some charm.
author: Michael E.

description:
Why haven't I ducked into this place sooner!? It's a lil gem for this section of the Mission. The front room is on the small side, but comfortable with interesting artwork everywhere. The back patio has 4 picnic tables, umbrellas, and a small covered lounge area consisting of chairs surrounding a coffee table. I'd imagine this area a perfect oasis for a nice cold drink on a warm sunny day. 

The service is exceptionally friendly and the food is very good. I tried the lamb and beef sliders, and they were both so flavorful! The patties were juicy and the caramelized onions were delicious! The different sauces and cheeses atop these bite sized morsels made for distinct flavors, and the fries were a great accompaniment. Will definitely head back soon!
author: Vicente G.

description:
Anyone who can replicate the roast beef goodness of Arby's, but gourmet-ize it, well they are a-ok in my belly. Speaking of which, those pork belly donuts do hit the sweet/savory spot, don't they? I've only been here during the day, but I like the set-up of the bar (most youngsters don't remember when this space was Country Station). 

Definitely a good spot to hang low, enjoy a few beers. Could this be the last hipster haven in the Nission without pretense? The street urchins and ghetto fab environs (sit by the front window for full effect) certainly might keep it that way.
author: Nish N.

description:
Sycamore is definitely a little different than your typical brunch sit-down. In the back is a really nice and relaxing outdoor seating area. We came in on a sunny San Francisco Sunday morning, and decided to sit outside. My friend and I weren't extremely hungry, and decided to order some of the more well known items from the brunch menu.  

Pork Belly Donuts - It was a mix between sweet and savory that hit my taste buds all a little too weirdly. However, I can't say I hated it because I really didn't. But I do wish that they put a little less sea salt on the top, since that definitely put my mouth on salt-overload. I would definitely order this again, but share it - it can get a little on the greasy side for one person to handle

Breakfast Chicken Slider - THIS WAS DELICIOUS. I think what made this so good was the gravy they had on the slider to accompany the fried chicken and bread. If you come here, be sure to order this, the other yelper definitely didn't recommend wrongly!

Chicken & Waffle - I never settled on the idea of chicken & waffles before, but since my palette was already introduced to the sweet & savory experience from the pork belly donuts, I was not hesitant on trying the chicken & waffle. I don't regret trying it either, it was really good! But since I really have nothing to compare it to, I can't give it too much of a review except that it's tasty. Perhaps this will lead me towards trying more chicken and waffle restaurants.. 

The waitresses are super friendly here, and they don't lie about bottomless mimosas. Your glass is NEVER empty. 

Parking was a little of a pain, but if you're patient enough and willing to walk a few blocks, its not so bad.
author: Gelene V.

description: Love this little unassuming hole in the wall with a small back patio and great food list.  I like coming here for a ginger beer and some pork belly donuts.  There's board games and a very friendly staff.
author: Aaron W.

description:
I found The Sycamore a year and a half ago when I took a new job in the neighborhood. The building looked funky and their chalkboard outside advertised one of my favorite beers, so I decided to give it a shot... it became my go-to neighborhood bay almost instantly. There was awesome music on the jukebox, the projector out back was playing a nature documentary about otters, the beer selection was well-curated and varied (not just increasingly-bitter variations of IPA, which has become trendy to the point of exclusion), and they still sold $2 Tecate for the times you just don't give a damn about adjectives. Later, I would come to realize the awe and majesty of their Chili Dog and other offerings; though the portion sizes vary considerably depending on what daily lunch special you order... none compare to the chili dog. I think I finished one.... once.
The outdoor seating is great; there's a little bench nook under a heat lamp if you're feeling social and a half-dozen picnic tables. I like to get there early (like noon), because I prefer drinking alone, and that first half of a sentence just made me sound like a loser, but that's how I roll. (See Tarun B's earlier review, where he describes the place as "A great place to kick it, make friends, or just plug in your headphones and ignore everyone"... truer words never spoken. I don't wear headphones though, because you overhear some outlandish shit posting up at the Sycamore.)
Moving right along then, they also have great art all over every surface of this place. Outside has a groovy mural, and the rotation of framed art indoors is also wonderful, usually on an off-kilter, comic-illustration sort of theme.
Most importantly, truly wonderful people work here, and you should tip generously. In fact, when I hear the staff talking about having to kick someone out, I'm inclined to ask prying questions... my loyalty to the Sycamore is such that an enemy of the Sycamore is an enemy of mine.
author: Bill G.

description:
there's dive, and then there's super dive, am i in the front of a fast and furious auto shop? kind of dive. this place is the latter. and although there are board games, they are on a hidden shelf so i haven't actually seen anyone play them.

other than that, it's got it's own vibe and outside area with picnic tables for those who can make it through the small front part. i would pass for better spots nearby, but sometimes you just want to go somewhere grimy and grab a beer.
author: Reyana F.

description: Who ever the bar back/chef on Halloween night was, handsome dude with the beard and glasses, voice deep in vibrato,  kind on the eyes and serious with passion, was worth all the culinary awards there is to give. His strength and power to handled the bar and his ability to multi task under pressure and pleasantly greet guest was outstanding. Also, all the bartenders on Halloween were on point and they all deserve a 100% raise and a paid trip to Mexico on the company credit card THEYRE THAT GOOD. Tip them in diamonds, [consensual] squeezes on the booty, and [tasteful] positive self esteem. Why? BECAUSE THEYRE HUMAN BEINGS. Happy Halloween, Google.
author: Dana F.

description:
The beer selection is more than any wo[man] would need on a random night is SF.  The alcohol levels are listed which I appreciate because it adds depth to the menu.  They aren't "just taps". 

The Black Bean Burger was the second best veggie burger i've had in SF in 11 years.  I'm not a vegetarian but I freak out for good HOUSEMADE Veggie Burgers. Bender's [19/South Van Ness] Veggie Burger and the one at Hillstone on the Warf [yeah, i know, the Warf...] 

They don't sell pitchers which kind of sucks in my opinion.  Even half pitchers would be great.  However, having pitchers might turn them into Zeitguist which is now overrun. The pint prices are ok.  They could have a few more cheap beers on tap.  just whining.  GREAT Staff.

I will probably update this to a 5 in the near future.
author: Jonathan B.

description: What a shame, an outdoor patio totally wasted. I love a good hole in the wall but they're no room in this city for wastelands like this space. I don't care how your decorate or if you do at all but please organize your chairs and tables to maximize the area. Perhaps your goal is to make your customers feel uncomfortable and unwanted and if this is so then you have succeeded.
author: Kelly C.

description:
these places fuckin suck. i hate places like this. pretentious people in a shitty/sticky ass (looking and feeling) establishment. 

We came in and waited, and waited, and waited. Then we found a table. thanked our lucky stars, and had a seat. there; we waited; and waited, and waited. WTF. so the BF goes up to the bar where he.... guess what.. waited. and waited. WTF. no one acknowledged us. he was flagging people down and so was I; and they were so busy/careless that they just ignored us. 

I really wanted to like this place. actually; i really didnt care about liking the place; but I really wanted to be able to try the food. but wtf. I really should not have to beg people to take my money. So; not so surprisingly, we said "F this" and left.
author: Lisa N.

description: This place has the worst money stealing, unfriendly bartenders in the mission. Will never go back.
author: Lo F.

description: Its barely ok. Its cramped and crowded, there's only beer and wine which is fine but the selection seems all over the place and inconsistent. Its food is not that good and the atmosphere is not the most comfortable. Its a spot for hipster yuppies.
author: Bantu Z.

description:
I've only ever gotten the sliders and pork belly donuts at the sycamore. I think the pork belly donuts are overrated. WAY too sweet for my taste. I was expecting more of a salty sugary explosion but only got sugary. Maybe the chef just forgot to add the salt?

On the other hand, these 3 bite burgers are SO GOOD. Delicious. Best sliders ever? Maybe. The fried chicken one with the onions was a perfect bite. The beef one was super good with caramelized onions and bleu cheese. I wish there was more cheese tho. They're like flavor bombs. Even my boyfriend was impressed and burgers don't impress him often.

However, the place smelled like... Dare I say it? Pee :( that made it kind of unappetizing so I think I'm strictly take out from now on.
author: Bianca W.

description: After reading all the yelp reviews, I thought its gonna be so good. But, BE AWARE, we Waited for more than one hour for mediocre food, atmosphere is loud and very small. I will never come back here
author: V L.

description:
Pork belly donuts? Have you heard of anything better? After hearing about these I jumped in my car and drove down to Sycamore. Only problem was they weren't open yet. After waiting 15 minutes until their 11:30 open time, I had already gone over and over what I was about to stuff my face with.
