The sliders are $3 each and for a buck more you can add a side of salad or fries.  They also have a good selection of beers on tap.
author: Paul K.

description:
I miss Cafe Prague that used to inhabit this space.  The Sycamore fills their absence nicely.  The back door patio is intact (if slightly rearranged) and on this trip, nobody peed a puddle under the alley-facing wall as we watched in horror.

The BEST reason we picked the place is because you can bring your dog in back.  My new dog got lots of love from everyone, so this place gets 4 bones for offering that opportunity as well as good food. 

I got the portabella sandwich with greens.  The seasoning on the mushroom was perfection.  I have never had a better one ever.  The greens were oiled and seasoned well and made for great nibbling in between their good beer on draft.  The only slight minus was the small-ish serving size.  The sandwich was at best medium-small and the basket with greens was small enough to reinforce that idea.  75% of the time I would probably complain the opposite about most restaurants overdoing it- this one left me hungry enough to need a side of fries afterwards.  They also offer sliders, and a couple of those could add to a meal, but I felt a little uncomfortable about the price for such small items.  Also the menu is not very extensive.  I'd wish to see those addressed at least a little.  But otherwise, this was good food with good beers and gastropub ambiance.  I recommend giving it a visit to make up your own mind.
author: Pat L.

description: Go here for bottomless mimosas and brunch on the weekends! They have a friendly staff and a good beer selection. The venue is small, but also cozy.
author: Mandisa C.

description: Love this place!  Small relaxed joint with an outdoor back patio.  Board games galore not that we had time for them in between stuffing our faces with pork belly donuts,sliders and drinks.  One order of the donuts to share was more than enough.  Bottomless mimosas and bloody murdy's completed our meal.  Cool place to hang out with a couple of pals.  Will be back!
author: Jenny I.

description: Been meaning to try this place and went for a late lunch last weekend.  It was pretty empty.  Bartender was really friendly; food was delicious.  Have to try the Pork Belly Donuts next time.  Seems like it would be a nice place to spend more time; probably need to try it when it's more crowded.
author: Ryan T.

description: I've been here several times now, for a quick beer, lunch, and a few bottomless brunches. All I can say is how great this little corner bar is. The inside is a cozy dive and the back patio is my favorite place to eat and replenish my vitamin d. If you get there early on a weekend you can grab a bench or stake out the corner table w comfy chairs and soak up the sun over bottomless mimosas and yummy food. The pork belly doughnuts are my favorite hangover cure. The breakfast sliders and benedicts are yummy. The staff is so low key and friendly. The mimosa bartender will talk to you all morning while making her rounds to make sure your glass never goes empty. And to top it off, they play great music and have board games. I have mad love for this place.
author: Jessi N.

description: Love the food, bottomless mimosas and game. Great place to hangout on a sunday afternoon.
author: Corvette M.

description: cool place, good staff, fun in the back
author: Kash K.

description: Sliders rock, especially the fried chicken. Definitely a notch above your standard gastropub grub. Super nice brother/sister team
author: Daniel K.

description:
Stumbled upon this quaint little gem on the way to an art show across the street. What a lucky find!

Pork belly donuts were the JAM. For those reviewers complaining that the dish is too fatty, well, it's friggin' pork belly. Also had their catfish sliders which were light, crunchy and flavorful! So good. Washed it all down with some Deschutes Porter and I was good to go.

Will definitely return.
author: Tyler D.

description: Anyone who doesn't give this bar five stars should get kicked in the nuts, or boobs. Not too divey. Not too hipster. Just the right amount of bluegrass (on certain nights).
author: Sean K.

description: AWESOME!!  The Syc was the perfect place to spend a rainy and cold Monday night. Love it love it love it! Our birthday party of 7 happened to be there for trivia night and had an awesome time. Great food, great beer selection and a nice mix of friendly folks. The owners and staff are such friendly people, too. I really can't help but love this place. I love it so much that I don't even care that the owners are from Boston and Red Sox fans :). Seriously. I hate to give the secret away but The Syc is the bombdiggity!
author: C P.

description: Shout out to Tim and Kim! Super friendly service in a casual environment. Delicious food! Nice selection of beers. Awesome back patio.
author: Marissa P.

description: This is a fantastic new place for decently priced eats, an outdoor patio, a cozy inside, knowledgeable and humorous staff and lots of great beer on tap.  Be sure to order their special N. Shore (outta' Massachusetts) warm roast beef sandwich.  The special sauce can't be beat.
author: Alyssa L.

description: I had the mix and match sliders...fried chicken, beer battered catfish and beef with blue cheese.  They were GREAT!!  The ambiance is laid back and they have an outdoor patio.  The staff is super friendly and they have an excellent variety microbrews and wine.  I have to make their weekend brunch for their bottomless mimosas and awesome brunch menu.  I highly recommend this place.
author: Ricardo A.

description: Come here for the beer.. not so much for the food. Lovely vibe for hanging with friends and shootin' the sh*t. With the exception of the pork belly donuts which was somewhat adequate, the food was very mediocre and overpriced for the quality.
author: M C.

description: good beer selection & cool outdoor seating area
author: Grant B.

description: Awesome lamb sliders, pork pulled sandwiches and an array of eclectic beers.. Chef Aly makes yummy food.
author: Robin F.

description: three words. "PORK BELLY DONUTS"  If that phrase doesn't shake you to your core, congratulations, you have no taste & possibly no soul (vegetarians excluded of course ;)).  not only the donuts but breakfast sandwich sliders even salads are prefection and the owner Liz couldn"t be sweeter.  While you wait for a friend, chat it up @ the bar and grab a game of connect four.  you will not be disappointed!
author: Raven D.

description: Delicious hot and crispy french fries and decent lamb sliders. Menu and price is right for a quick snack.
author: Amina B.

description: Pork belly doughnuts! Yum! Great food, good beer selection, and friendly staff. Large outdoor area to smoke your medicinal stuff as well!
author: Scott L.

description:
We went here sort of on a whim, and I'm really glad that we did. I can get a single slider and some fries for around $5. This is great for me because I tend to eat a lot of small meals during the day and I hate to waste money or take food home with me when we're out and about. We sat inside, but the patio looked nice. 

Don't come here if you're expecting anything fancy or want someplace spotless. Good food, good beer, relaxing atmosphere, oh and lets not forget the shelf of boardgames that anyone can pull down and play.
author: Alison T.

description: Had a party here earlier this week, and it was a great time.  Excellent jukebox (with a bias towards 80's punk, which is right up my alley!), friendly bar staff, good selection of beers, nice comfortable space (we had about 15-20 guests), welcoming vibe.  The sliders were pretty good, but I wasn't a huge fan of the pork belly donuts -- even taking their description into account they were too rich and salty and fatty.  I could barely finish one.  There was a bluegrass band jamming on the patio, and that was fun too.  I'll definitely be going back.
author: Tee Jay R.

description: Cool to the point where hipsters & non-hipsters can coexist in one place, joined by a fantastic beer selection & good food.  The inside is rather small, but the outside patio is where it's at.  Grab a seat on one of the benches and make some new friends while you wait for your food.  Sycamore is known for its sliders, they're a bit pricey ($3 a piece), but the fantastically amazing beer selection totally makes up for it.  Had the Rock Cod & Lamb sliders.  The Rock Cod was a nice large piece fried to crispy perfection, could have used some more of that sriracha aioli though.  The lamb was very flavorful.  Beer selection changes when the keg runs out! Be sure to check out what's on tap at beermenus.com.
author: Danny T.

description: Good, reasonably priced bar food; cozy atmosphere; great beer selection on tap...what's not to love?
author: Kendall D.

description: If you're craving a roast beef sandwich, then you need to go here. I'm not necessarily a mayo and sauce kind of guy, but my friend insisted it's the only way to order it--and she was right. The people are great. The menu has some fantastic -tasting comfort food, and you can add a salad or fries to any sandwich for a buck. It's small. But it's got big flavor.
author: Jagger E.

description:
The donuts are definitely amazing. The beer is good and cheap. I like the board games. 

Minus one star for the following:
We got some kind of porcini mushroom thing that was delicious but came with supermarket-grade whole wheat toast. Really?
There was some kind of odd smell- and not the stale beer bar smell. It may have just been the hipsters, though.
author: Max B.

description: Awesome place for brunch! Cute little patio in the back, try to get there early on a nice day as there is limited seating. Staff is great and the atmosphere is laid back. The people sitting next to us even shared their pork belly donut with us :) The mimosas were cold, refreshing and bottomless ($12)! Perfect way to start our Saturday!
author: Lauren G.

description: Came here on a whim after work one night and was pleasantly surprised.  Ordering situation was slightly confusing: we didn't know whether to order at the bar or wait for someone to come take our order (figured out we order at the counter).  We ordered the pulled pork sandwich and the roast beef sandwich which both come with a side of their delectable fries.  Beer selection is respectable and the sandwiches we KILLER.  The roast beef was tender and piled high and the pulled pork was so moist and hot.  Next time we'll try the sliders!  While I'll miss Cafe Prague, the Sycamore has filled its place on Mission nicely.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
As soon as we walked into the Sycamore with our group of six people, we were disappointed by the size of the place. But, it's the Mission right? Our mood was slightly elevated once we saw an outside place, however there were only a few tables out there and they were all taken. Yet, we found a way to stuff our hungry, slightly tipsy bodies into the front room. We sat there for about 10 minutes and then realized that we had to order at the bar. No problemo. We each went up and ordered what we wanted. The bar tenders were very nice and had no problem with us ordering individually. I was kind of afraid that they would force us to all be on one tab since we were sitting together, but they didn't mention it. Good stuff. 

On to the food: I ordered one of each slider - lamb, ground beef, BLT and fried chicken. I also ordered a basket of fries. The sliders are $3 each and the large basket of fries only $5. I think the prices are very reasonable. Oh yeah, and the table go a bunch of pork belly donuts. 

The food came out in about 25 minutes. Good timing I thought. But it could have taken longer - the food was AMAZING. Each slider was amazingly tasty and amazingly different from one another. My first bite, the lamb. Awesome. The second bite, the ground beef. A burst of beef and bleu cheese. The third bite, the fried chicken, so juicy. The fourth bite, the BLT, the bacon was from another world. And so the bites went on until everything was gone, crumb and all. The fries were regular fries. Middle of the road. They met my expectations, however, thinking back, I would have thought they would have gourmet'ed the fries up a bit. Seeing as the sliders are so well done, I think they should add some kind of special touch to the fries (how about truffle butter fries?) But, I was happily downing $2 PBR and chompin' away on the fries so I had no issue. 

But alas, the pork belly donuts. These are just one of those things that, when you bite into them for the first time, you immediately check mark a box on the list of things that you want to experience before you die. You want to run outside and tell everyone how amazing they are. Crispy sweet glazed outside, fatty pork belly on the inside. They lasted 5 seconds around the table. 

The beer selection is quite good, but I think they charge a pretty penny for some of the more gourmet beer options. $9 for Delirium Tremens? I think they could push $8. BUT, they have $2 PBRs if you want to be a cheap bastich like me. Good draft beer selection. They ran out of Boddingtons while we were there though, so, that was kind of disappointing. I can live without it though. 

This place has some neat stuff too - an interesting little juke box as well as classic board/card games (Sorry! and Apples 2 Apples). Good for a group looking to spend some quality time together.

Summary:

PROs:
1) The most awesome sliders you'll ever eat.
2) Pork belly donuts.
3) Good beer selection with reasonable options if you're feeling stingy
4) Friendly staff (when I asked if water was possible, the waitress said "Oh, ANYTHING is possible." I like to hear that.)
5) Fun and games for the group - juke box and board games. 
6) Oh yeah, and props for letting us shotgun PBR's in the back (at least I think they were cool with it). 
 
CONs
1) They weren't too smart with their placement of seating in the outside back area. I think they could have set it up to hold more people wanting to sit. The design of the back area looked a bit unfinished as well. 
2) Fries needed more umph. They were forgettable.
author: Matt S.

description:
i had the carnitas benedict for brunch and i almost melted off my stool. so delicious. i have also tried the lamb & cod sliders both bite fulls of yumminess. pair their famous roast beef sandwich and fries with a glass of fuller london brew and just feel the contentment. ahhhh
the bathroom and back patio area could just some refinement, but the food and beer can't be beat.
author: Rosalee R.

description: We went to this Pub on a family trip to San Fran. We really had no idea what to expect, but heard the beer selection was great. We showed up after a 2 mi. walk, exhausted with our kids, and the people were so friendly. They let us move tables together, had board games for the kids. The food was great, and an epic beer selection. Its not fancy, but very much a cool place to hang out at. Considering the local crowd, their hospitality to these SoCal tourists was really cool. Thanks.
author: Jason L.

description: This spot have lots cool beer collection and guess what their slider is the bomb!!! Sooo good melt in your mouth... Also we'd night live music.. And some outdoor space behind too!!
author: Elsa K.

description: Yum lamb sliders! Yum roast beef sandwich!  Nice selection of board games and music.  Cute back patio.  And the owners are the best!
author: Elena R.

description: Great beer selection and insanely great sliders. What else do you need?
author: Sachin A.

description:
Great neighborhood pub with a limited, but very good food selection.  Very good beer selection.  Cool/worn back deck.  Limited seating indoors, but very cozy.  

Only problem (which I consider large since I hate rudeness in this industry) was that I was turned away at about 11:50pm one night for a beer when their door was still wide open.  I was told at the bar slightly brusquely, "we've already closed..."  with a bar full of people.
author: Robert G.

description:
Good pub food and great selection of beers.  Cool vibe and when you're not playing with one of the large selection of board games, there's some entertaining people watching from the Mission St windows :-)

Tim is beyond nice, which makes for a great experience.
author: christine r.

description:
We visited The Sycamore for brunch over the weekend.

I liked the pork belly donuts a lot. The maple glaze on the donut was so sweet and the pork, so savory. I ordered the fried chicken and egg sliders. They were both good. The only complaint I would have is the biscuits were a pretty hard.

My boyfriend had the Carnitas Benedictos which was delicious. 

Obviously they have a good beer selection. My only real complaint was that it took a surprisingly long time to get our food. Don't go here if you want a quick meal. 

Also, although we didn't sit there, the outdoor seating looked pretty nice for a sunny day - walk all the way to the back of the restaurant if that is what you're after.
author: Katherine S.

description: Fantastic slidders, fresh and full of flavor. Definately the sort of place to waste a few hours with friends. Tim ,the barman, is super friendly.
author: Jenny H.

description: Had a Fantastic Roast Beef Sandwich cooked to perfection with a great sauce. Tasted the Lamb burger, Pulled pork all EXCELLENT! Nice people, nice place. Will go back!
author: Sparky W.

description: Ok first off, they have RIsk, Sorry! AND Operation in the games pile. ho cool is that? The jukie is diverse and fun. Sliders are tasty, and the fairly priced beer list is equally fun. Then the back patio is welcoming and a welcome respite from the megpationess of Zeit and Rio - not that those aren't fun. This is smaller and more - how to put this - patio like? Its a great spot - convivial (i just had to use that word for fun but it really fits), great location, cool decor. Just do yourself a favor and go here. Oh and bonus! the Banksy on the wall outside . . .
author: randi v.

description: Went here with a group of friends for drinks and food. We sat outside, which was nice. Strong smell of cigarettes, but that's par for the course when you're in a small, fairly enclosed terrace. We ordered, but about six or seven items weren't available due to a mishap with their fridge. The food took 45 minutes to arrive - and we only ordered sliders and grilled cheese! The food finally arrived, at different times. The waiter was rude, some of the food was burnt, the salad was limp and over-dressed, and the fries were kind of soggy. The grilled cheese should have been way better for 8$. People in my group were still hungry, but we didny want to wait another hour for overpriced crappy food, so we went around the corner. I've been in SF for 9 months and this was the worst dining experience I've had. With all the better options in the mission, I certainly wouldn't go back for food, and probably would check out somewhere else for drinks.
author: Jasmine H.

description: This is my hands down favorite hangout in the city. Pick a night/day and they will do you right. It is IMPOSSIBLE to find a better/cheaper bottomless mimosa brunch in the city. Friendly people top to bottom. Don't be a douche tip well they work hard
author: ethan h.

description: A solid 3.5 stars for this place, but they get an extra half star because the people were nice and because of the surprise trivia night we stumbled into.  The place was much smaller than I imagined, but definitely had a nice feel when we walked in.  We sidled up to the bar, and ordered about half the menu, including the famous / infamous pork belly donuts (a bit overrated, but fried very well), the fried mac & cheese balls (totally delicious, but heart clogging), and a variety of the sliders, including the lamb (the best that we tried), the beef (a close second), the catfish (good, but not great), and the fried chicken (not that good, according to my wife).  It was really good food for a bar, and they had a nice diverse beer selection.  The trivia night was fun, but the lack of organization and "fairness" (we were a team of 3, while another team had at least 9 people) made it not as fun as other trivia nights.  However, once my heart and arteries are ready, I look forward to my next trip back, and I'm bringing trivia reinforcements!
author: Pilan C.

description: love it! Delightful atmosphere with interesting art, cozy patio with comfy chairs.  Tasty snacks & interesting peeps.  Great place to meep after a Thrift Town adventure.
author: T L.

description: Bottomless mimosas. Their eggs benedict is better than in Mission Bay cafe. Bloody mary is almost as good as at Zeitgeist. (In fact i think of this place as a mini Zeitgeist). Excellent jukebox. Great atmosphere. This place is a winner, especially when it comes to weekend brunch.
author: Shmuyator O.

description: I've been there several times:) I can't get enough of those crispy delicious fries!!!! And hellooo Pork Belly Doughnuts! They melt in your mouth and very addicting. Let's not forget the bar! The Best Beer in the city. It's a  cool, hip, kick back place to go hang out.
author: Angela C.

description:
The Sycamore is my new favorite hang out, that has my new favorite sandwich... the roast beef is the definition of divine.

I also appreciate the car that has gone into the selections of beers and wine. The prices are spot on, and the patio is a wonderful respite.

Two thumbs up!
author: Jocelyn H.

description:
Absolutely love the food here! Roast beef sandwich and sliders are great. The fries are crispy and perfectly salted. Side salads perfectly dressed. Top it off with Makers Mark pork belly donuts. Yum!
Good music selection but occasionally they choose to blast it. I skip it those nights. There are too many choices of bars in the Mission where it is too loud for conversation. It's actually a selling point when a place recognizes that people may actually want to talk to the person next to them. Most nights that is the Sycamore. So siked they opened up in the hood!
author: Tonya Z.

description: Not my style, but I can see why people with other tastes would like it.    If this is your type of place, they do it well.
author: Gregory D.

description: delicious brunch (french toast, mmm!) with equally delicious mimosas ($10 for bottomless until 4PM, double mmm!). we came here before heading over to outside lands music fest and i was very pleasantly impressed with both the way of service (order at the counter, delivered to your table) and the food itself. fair portion sizes so my best friend and i were able to split our brunch options amongst the two of us. the lady who refilled our mimosas also had a wicked pour and never let my glass get less than half full - bless her heart :)
author: Lori K.

description: Terrific location - I am always coming & going via the 16th St BART - and yet never noticed this place before. When you walk in, it looks half-coffeeshop with boardgames, half-neighborhood pub with youngsters. Couldn't even tell they had food but still I persevered, taking a seat at the bar. The bartender on duty & an off-duty one having a drink both friendly, good senses of humor. One advised me on what to order; the other offered beer tastes. Draughts $1 off, so I tried a domestic saison and one of the ancient recipes Dogfish has been reviving, which made for interesting chat. If it hadn't been Happy Hour; however, I would've gone with Maudite or Delirium, as the bottle offerings appealed more than what was on tap. My 3 sliders (1 lamb, 2 beef) & basic side salad arrived immediately: rich & juicy & delish! Though $3.50 for a (rather large) slider seemed a bit pricy, the final bill - $21.50 for dinner and 2 beers - certainly was not! Exactly what I wanted before the theater.
author: Faith A.

description: What a marvelous spot.  A perfect combination of terrific beer selection, absolutely delicious mini-sandwiches (and big ones too) and a fantastic jukebox.  Added bonus, there's a nice back patio, eye-catching art on the walls, AND Banksy did his one piece in San Francisco right outside their front door on the side of the building.  My friends brought me here last week, and I've already been back twice.  Totally hip and unpretentious at the same time.
author: Eileen H.

description:
I visited last week- absolutely loved the place.  The sliders were all delicious (my goodness, the blue cheese and roast beef ones!), and the beers were a wide variety- and the staff were knowledgeable about what they'd recommend as a comparable brew to the ones I favor.  I'm already planning to visit to try out more of the menu. 

The location's easy to get to by public transit (about a block and a half from BART & the 22 Fillmore; 1/2 block from the 33 Stanyan)- and the interior is cosy-feeling, with a jukebox that was 90% artists I knew, and 10% artists I was forced to assume I'd like.  And for those of you who smoke, this bar's got a back porch where you can take your beer, and enjoy your cigarette, without being asked by random passers-by for a spare one (sorry, buddy- I only got 20 in this pack!).
author: Turner M.

description:
My husband and I were so glad we stumbled into this place before heading back to our hood (Tenderloin) after a night of bar hopping in the Mission.
The owners are from Boston, which is where I am from so off to a good start already.
Kitchen had just closed but we will be coming back to try the roast beef sandwich.
The jukebox has some tunes from older Boston bands and we had fun chatting about our favorite bands from back home.
Beer selection looked amazing.
All in all a real gem. We will return.
author: Angela C.

description: Great food. Warm friendly family environment in a great location. Food is amazing and they have a fantastic beer selection. Even though they are new I highly recommend this place!
author: Bo O.

description: Hey they got a patio and its relatively nice to drink beers out there. Thats cool. What is not cool is the food. Holy hell. I should have gone with the sliders, but blek I chose the pulled pork sandwich and it was disgusting'o'rama. When i got it the whole bottom part of the bun was completely drenched, soggy and no longer held bun form. I picked it up and it broke away, falling onto the wet paper towel below.  I was left attempting to hold together the fatty bits of flavorless meat. I wasn't about to get suckered to pay 8 bucks for no sustinence, so I reluctantly slurped it down, not in any pleasurable way I assure you and chugged my beer and got the hell out of there. I liked the janky place it was before, Cafe Prague much more. Perhaps the sliders are better? The woman who sat TOO CLOSE to me on the bench seemed to enjoy hers, I could tell because she was chewing right next to my ear. Then I went to Oakland Pride and it was much more fun, where I got pork on a stick that was comparably priced but so much better. This place was rank yo.
author: Ryan C.

description:
what's good:  
- Cozy dim atmosphere was great to chill with a friend after work.
- The bartender was low key like a friend hosting a party.
- Good beer selection with nibbles to round out the menu.
- The sliders were fun to mix and match and had good flavors in a little bite.
- I love bars with boardgames!

what's bad:
- The salad was bland, oily and limp.  Worst salad I have ever had.  I know you're asking what would I expect from a bar, but it's a gastropub, and if it's going to suck so bad, why bother to put it on the menu?  
- Service is minimal.  Go to the bar to order, get water refills, and wait in line with others trying to get drinks to get your bill and pay.  
- It was freezing!  I kept my coat on.  When I went to the bathroom I saw they had the door to the alley in the back open.
- Not horrible, but kind of weird, but in said bathroom, the trash had onion peels in it.  Are they peeling onions in the bathroom?  
- First order of fries hit the spot, but the second order was hard.

Overall, solid positive points are not terribly detracted by the random negative ones (just don't order a salad.)  Think of it more as a low key bar with food, not a gastropub, and expect to work for you supper.  Worth checking out, and worth coming back.  

great for:  
- hang out with the gang
- non pressured first date
author: mindful g.

description: a place soooo disgusting we walked out before ordering!  we sat at the bar (for brunch) but the music was blasting so loud we couldn't hear what the waitress said when she handed us two filthy, greasy, torn, menus. if the menu is any indication of what comes out of the kitchen, we were smart to get the hell out of that hole and fast.
author: Loyal C.

description: This place is awesome.  The staff were extremely nice and the bacon donuts were fabulous.  I will be back soon.
author: Tim M.

description: I've been here 3 times- but have yet to try the food. Just stopped in for drinks with a variety of different friends each time. They'd be 5 stars for sure if they had a full bar, and had a non-smoking outdoor patio! But alas, they only serve beer and wine (and "sangria" although it seems to just be cheap wine with some fruit chopped up in it... that's not actually sangria FYI), and there's always a plethora of smokers on the patio (seems odd to me to have to go INSIDE to get fresh air... eww). It's so nice to find a spot in the mission on a Saturday night where I can find a place to sit with a group of 7 friends, and we don't have to scream at each other over juke box hits from the 90's in order to hear each other! And I don't have to be at Zeitgeist to be outside. Yay for Sycamore!
author: Brandi C.

description: I stopped in one evening, hungry for some food and beer.  I had two sliders (chicken and fish) with fries, and also the pork belly donuts.  The donuts were delicious, with just the right amount of pork flavor.  The sliders were satisfying and perfectly cooked and topped.  The fries were cooked to my exact liking--crispy on the outside but not dried out and nasty in the middle.  The beers on tap were good and reasonably priced, plus the happy hour is $1 off all on-tap beers.  I sat at the bar, so service was good.  I would certainly stop back here, especially if I was in The Mission in the late evening after some bar hopping.
author: Jason S.

description: great value. sweet art and laid back ambiance. solid draft selection.. and their meat is all cooked perfectly. the roast beef is on my top 5 sandwiches list!
author: Christian R.

description: I'm going to address all the people on here that have complained about the Sycamore: this is not the perfect gastropub you are looking for in your ideal world. Their food is really good because they put time and effort in making everything (and the chef who helped design the menu has worked at some pretty high end establishments), the beers are carefully selected (as well as the wines and other drinkables) and the jukebox music is hand selected by the sibling owners. The reason why it says on here that it's good for groups is largely because of the outdoor patio, which is fabulous when it's warm out, which is frequently the case in the Mission. If it's too small for you and your friends, go to Zeitgeist (and suffer their douchebag wrath). The slanting floor is not their fault, DEAL WITH IT and watch where you're walking. On that note, I liked their fried chicken and new catfish slider last night! I think the fries are NOMMY! Thanks to Liz and Tym for such a great little bar with great food that is really affordable AND delicious!
author: Gina R.

description: i was walking down mission street and saw that a new establishment has taken over the old prague restaurant. I was pleasantly surprised ,the space looks fabulous. Tim the owner was super Kool  and i had my new favorite sandwich the boston meat. sooo fricken good it's one of those sandwiches that from first bite you are addicted. You gotta try em.  they also have a back space to hang out. i give this new place 5 ++ stars check it out and have one of those sandwiches you will not be disappointed.
author: antoinette s.

description: This place has good beer on tap, tasty sliders, and a great vibe. On top of that they have a comfy (albeit rustic) outdoor patio. I'll definitely be going back.
author: Matt B.

description: good food, good beer, chill atmosphere, awesome patio, and boardgames. what more do ya want?
author: Davey G.

description: very minimal on the atmosphere, but i like that you can get tasty foods like pork belly donuts and lamb sliders without feeling obligated to froo froo up.
author: beverly l.

description: There are just so many reasons to go to the Sycamore: a) the food is excellent (I've had the roast beef sandwich and the lamb sliders with fries so far, both of which were amazing, and even as a commited carnivore, someone I knew had the mushrooms, which looked and smelled great - I'm trying them next time), b) the drinks are many and varied (nice to see a selection of tasty ales on draught - Deschutes and Boont, for example - as well as a large selection of bottled beers and wines), c) the decor is uber-cool (original art by some top-notch local artists adorns the dark-red walls, and smart black-and-white cushions are dotted around the benches), d) the location is ideal to watch Mission life through the huge windows and over the stable door, or to chill out on the sequestered patio at the back - an ideal way to start the weekend - or wind it up after a Sunday afternoon at Dolores Park (as I myself did last Sunday with some friends after the SF Symphony concert), e) the jukebox is jam-packed with gems of great playability from the last 40 years (Eels, Bowie, Buzzcocks, Iggy, Lou Reed ...) and last but not least f) Tym and Liz are great people who will happily spend hours chatting to all and sundry - I've only known them for a couple of months, but I know they've been planning the Sycamore for a long time, and I am so glad that their hard work has borne fruit.
author: Daen d.

description:
i love this place they have

1. BOARD GAMES

2. AN AMAZING JUKEBOX

3. AWESOME OWNERS

4. AN OUTSIDE PATIO
author: nata c.

description:
good stuff
catfish and lamb sliders, good but small $4
beef and pork sannies w fries or salad $1 extra, good $8
typical Mission joint
worth a try!
author: R S.

description: Great beer selection ...food well prepared.  I only wish I was in a position to have their unlmited Mimosa's.
author: andrew j.

description: Great cozy gastro pub with an arty neighborhood bar feel. Very creative appetizer menu. Good beer selection. Very friendly down to earth and helpful owner bartender Liz. Fun crowd.
author: sanjee w.

description:
Food
*Pork Belly Donuts - Sometimes you just want something that has the perfect combination of crispy, salty, and fatty. What you're craving is the pork belly donut from The Sycamore. The Sycamore provides the richness and tenderness of perfect pork surrounded by a crunchy fried hollow sphere.
*Fried Chicken Slider - It sounds amazing in theory, and it might be in execution... but not always. The biscuit was a bit dry. I was also surprised since I had assumed the chicken would be southern-style fried chicken but was instead covered in what looked like panko crumbs. It was good, but not as great as I wanted it to be.
*Fried egg + Bacon Slider - If you love the messiness of slicing into a fried egg over potatoes, and you want this messiness on your fingers, you should definitely get this slider.
*Beef Slider - I didn't get this, but my friend Mark swears that it's the best thing he ate that day. And we ate a lot that day.
*Fries - They were perfect. There was the perfect ratio of crispy to soft potato. They were seasoned just right. These fries were fantaaastic.

Ambience
*Board games - Uh, they have board games. We didn't play any, but I loved the fact that they had 'em.
*Cozy/cramped - It's San Francisco, so what do you expect?

Service
*One waitress? - We only had one server on a Saturday morning, and didn't see anyone else serving customers. The place was full. We got our food, but we weren't checked on and we got our own ketchup because we couldn't find the waitress. We also overheard her say "Oh those people are about to leave" to a few incoming customers, and were rushed out.

Bottom Line: The food was quite good, I was okay with the ambience, but the service was rushed at best.
author: Audrey K.

description: Great beer selection, tasty tasty food, friendly staff, unpretentious interior, inexpensive.  This is fast becoming a favorite.
author: Austin H.

description: love this place!  live music on thursday nights -bluegrass- and great food and service.  perfect place to hang out with small or large groups.  i love the back patio.
author: Kasi S.

description: Good stuff - small noisy space with lots of character - I especially like the collection of board games tucked under the juke box.  The sliders were good, my wife loved the mushroom appetizer.  The roast beef sandwich was very good.  Based on the hype, I was hoping for heaven on a plate, and while it didn't quite reach that level, we'll be going back.
author: Brian C.

description: Upon arriving, I was greeted by what seemed to be some regulars and the chef? owner? not really sure. Either way we talked shop for a bit while I waited for my brother. The bartender/waitress/cashier helped me select a tap beer and even offered a sample or two. When my dashing brother arrived we got down to ordering food.  We came specifically for the roast beef and ordered just that. I wanted pork belly donuts but was veto-ed. Instead we added a couple sliders and side salad, just to counterbalance the amount of grease and breading we were about to ingest. We sat in the backyard as it was a sunny San Francisco afternoon. Our food was delivered quickly. The roast beef sando was big and sloppy and saucy and tasty. The sliders were mediocre across the board. My fave was probably the fried chicken. The catfish was a little heavy on the oil and the lamb was decent. Overall, the price was right and the service friendly. If I still lived in this perfect city I would go again for a late afternoon snack/beer. Thanks ladies.
author: Jessica K.
